Reviews.Title: “Look out for the rip off at breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AntonT
Reviews.Content: This well located, well run comfortable hotel shoots itself in the foot when it comes to pricing. The basic rate is bed only, for an extra 19 Euro one can buy a breakfast if booked in advance, however if you elect to walk in the same breakfast with dry cold scrambled eggs, no service whatsoever ( you even help yourself to tea or coffee) will cost you 24 Euro. This is ridiculously expensive in a city where a McDonald's Hamburger cost 1 Euro and a Big Mac cost 3 Euro. There are a number of good establishments offering an English breakfast within a few hundred meters for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Urban rooms are nice”
Reviews.Author: flaljee
Reviews.Content: Formerly known as the Victoria Hotel, this hotel stands right across from Centraal Station in the heart of Amsterdam. The building is a historic building, which also means it is a bit dated. They have two distinct styles of rooms, the regular and the urban. I prefer the urban rooms with their modern, decor, red accents, dark furniture and fresh feel, despite the smaller space. By contrast, the regular rooms are larger, with dated furniture, creaking floor boards and a more traditional look. Service at the hotel is average, probably because they are always busy. So if you are looking for personal attention, this place is not for you. A big plus staying at this hotel is the free high speed wifi. For some reason, you have to â€œbuyâ€� high speed internet from your room and then they take it off your bill at checkout. I find this to be odd and bothersome. During one of my stays here, they forgot to take off the internet from the bill, and I had to call to get it adjusted. There is a nice swimming pool that guests can use, but access to sauna or fitness center costs extra. Finally, room service is rather expensive. But this is the case in most hotels in Amsterdam. I ordered a meal that cost â‚¬23 at retail price, but they added room charge of â‚¬7.50 and another â‚¬6.00 in service fee. Before I knew it, my bill was â‚¬36.

Reviews.Title: “park plaza victoria.”
Reviews.Author: esmond357
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for my husbands 40th birthday , fabulous hotel right opposite the central train station,we nfelt safe being out and around the hotel during the evening too as its lit up beautifully. We stayed on a bed and breakfast status and the food was first class, they had everything you wanted and the food looked fresh and plentyfull. The hotel has a lovely spa facility too which we used one evening. Pool, steam room , sauna, etc. We were advised by the hotel where to go and how to get better deals for some of the trips we went on. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone who is thinking of going.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: Philip3012
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel for a short break in Amsterdam. We stayed in the new wing of the hotel with a spacious modern room. Connecting doors allowed us to keep an eye on the kids. All comfort available in the room and the nice bathroom. Of course the kids loved the indoor swimming pool. Personnel is very attentive and provides you with all the service you like. Breakfast gave everything you could think off. The price goes hand-in-hand with the choice. â‚¬ 25,- pp for it is at the high end of the spectrum. Ideally located for sightseeing if you donâ€™t mind the special ambiance in the streets behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brillant”
Reviews.Author: nomispsp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three night in February, The place was great when we booked on travelrepublic we paid for a double room but when we arived we were in an executive room which was brilliant a large room with everything you needed, Breakfast was great buffet style with a large choise from hot or cold with youre eggs cooked on order, not a rubber one under a heat light. Staff were helpfull. The perfect location for looking around, The train staition is just across the road and your on the main street that heads down to Dam square with everything close, The trams are easy to use just buy a ticket at the staition then just hop on and off as you please, The best way to get around.

Reviews.Title: “We got what we wanted.”
Reviews.Author: qGonga
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, our room was a little tired although spotless. I understand the urban wing is updated. Lots of building works going on outside so bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: urv123
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. The appearance, food, location was perfect. I'd particularly like to thank the concierges, they were a great source for information about the local area and can even provide you with discounts to local attractions, so its definetly worth seeing them if you are contemplating doing some sight seeing etc. The food was goooooooooorgeous. I would have licked my plate clean if there was no-one around! The reception team were a little slow as it took me a while to check in and out, but thats not a biggy for me! I'd definetly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay centrally in Amsterdam and within walking distance to the main local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT”
Reviews.Author: NPreece
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Amsterdam and I found the Park Plaza Victoria on the trip advisor site. What a brilliant hotel, newly renovated rooms, very central (right opposite the central station) but not noisy, the food was excellent (both lunch, dinner and breakfast) and the concierge service brilliant! I will definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Well situated for weekend break”
Reviews.Author: ilovegoldens
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated just opposite the main station making it ideal for travellers from Schipol Airport, It is in a very busy area but the hotel itself is fairly quiet inside. Facilities are good and rooms comfortable but could do with a bit of upgrading. Quite expensive for food and drink. Has a buzzing atmosphere, but if you are looking for a traditional and peaceful place it may not suit you. Just a short walk to the main sights - including the red light district! OK for a short weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Love_Friday
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and really mixed feelings. Last year stayed in the older part and, like an earlier review, the corridor smelt disgusting but we went back again this year, really because of the excellent location of the hotel. Stayed in the urban wing this time which is very pleasant and modern. The room (757) was very cold, even though the radiator was on, and there isn't any heating in the bathroom so that was even colder. The curtains are long and thick and covered the radiator when drawn. Told reception, after the first night, how cold the room was and was told they would give us a heater. No heater arrived but we drew the curtains and had to screw them up behind and over the radiator so we could get some heat from it. Problem then was it was noisy as you could hear the water running through the radiator. Told reception and concierge again, the second morning, and again promised a heater and again one didn't arrive. Left the next day so obviously didn't pursue it further. The maid wasn't very good either, she never replaced the empty tissue box just left it wide open in the bathroom, she took my own soap, well it disappeared, she took the used hotel flannels and didn't replace them with clean ones and she never dusted the bedside tables. Needless to say she didn't get a tip!! Other than that it was fine. The staff are very friendly and helpful, except for trying to get a heater and the concierges are great for guidance, directions etc. The location is brilliant, near the station, shops, bars and restaurants. Having said all that we would probably go again but because of the location rather than anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: SC T
Reviews.Content: We like to stay in hotels in the city centre because I do not like to drive in unfamiliar places and will depend on public transport. This hotel is that kind of hotel in Amsterdam. It took only 15 mintues to take a train from airport to the central station. It then took us 5 minutes to reach the lobby of the hotel. Then we can start canal cruise, Kukenhof tour and other tours from departure points nearby. We can take a train from Central station to Venlo where we have gone to Floriade. By the way Floraide is more like a trade show than a flower show. We went to Foriade on the first two days and things are not yet running smoothly. For example we have bought two 2-day e-ticket online. Luckily we went there on April 5 the opeing day and on April 6. On April 6 we were initially refused admsision because the computer said that there is no more tickets in that bar code. How on earth can I spend 2 days ticket on April 5 alone? If we came at a later time we may probably be accussed for cheating. I better stop talking on side topics. Back to Victoria hotel itself, the staff at front desk was extremely friendly and let us have us early check in. The staff in the Concierge was extremely helpful in tour booking and luggage leaving. The new urban wing is well decorated. The bed is good for sound sleep, not too hard, not too soft. And there is hi fi.

Reviews.Title: “Definitively not worth the money and the hassle... horrible night after food poisoning......”
Reviews.Author: Athina L
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend went to Amsterdam for 2days and decided to spend the night in that hotel. The room was comfortable and looked clean but the bathroom still had the red stains from the fungal is the walls.... We decided to have our evening meal in the hotels restaurant....The food there was extremely expensive for the quality of it....the taste was less than average and we have had a horrible night after food poisoning(throwing all night.. )...We have spoken to the manager the day after and all they said/did was a "sorry"... . The only friendly and helpful person was the concierge in that hotel.... Also the common toilets, next to the restaurant were as clean as public toilets....not like a 4star hotel........

Reviews.Title: “horrible and poor service”
Reviews.Author: Anna A
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The first night was so noisy that I woke up around 6 times that night due to noises. We got that room although we in beforehand pointed out that we are sensitive to noise and they promised us a room in the less noisy area which we didn't get. Also, we forgot a very expensive new electrical toothbrush we want to get back. Now in Sweden, we have emailed them regarding this matter and called them 3 times, but every call leads to them giving us different (and wrong) email adresses. It took around 10 minutes for the lady in the reception to spell the email, and it was different from the email we first got. We have yet not received any response to our email regarding our lost property. When we called again to ask for it, the lady in the reception simply cut me off and said just email and hung up. SUCH poor service and unhelpful staff, will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lying is a No No”
Reviews.Author: Lina J
Reviews.Content: So we were pretty excited to spend our last night in Holland at this central hotel in Amsterdam. We get there and they were really nice and apologized to us that they have overbooked the hotel and are relocating us to another nearby sister hotel. We asked how far is it, first said 2 blocks (luckily one of my friends has travelled many times to Amsterdam before) and asked him to show us the hotel on the map, so the guy circled a location on the map to what seems like 4-6 blocks. After negotiating they did "upgrade us" for the next hotel and give us a bottle of wine- then we asked for the exact address and name of new hotel so we can start walking- they insisted on transferring us there via cab for our convenience. We waited about 1/2 hour for the cab, once we got it (also added another group of travellers with us in the cab) the cab started driving and driving away from the center of the city, to somewhere past the van gogh museum and beyond the total ride minutes was 25!!!! this was not the circle they had put in our map. When we got there we asked them to circle their location and it was somewhere in suburbs. This was NOT ACCEPTABLE. to be lied to?! really? I mean I've seen bad dutch service but not this bad. I honestly will never go back to this hotel. We ended up canceling our reservation and went back to the amazing four points by the central station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lucy F
Reviews.Content: Could not fault this hotel or it's friendly staff. Very well located to everything. The staff were very friendly and Dennis on the concierge desk went out of his way to help us with booking a cruise and then a taxi - nothing was too much trouble. The Urban room was quite funky and the bathroom suite clean and shower was heavenly. Would definitely staff here again. The bar in the evening was quite busy but waiter service was good and cocktails delicious!

Reviews.Title: “the mouse is included in the breakfast...”
Reviews.Author: pballi Posted by a Viaggiare traveler
Reviews.Content: The only positive thing I could find in this hotel was the location: just in front the central station that connects you to the airport with a direct train in about 20 min if I am not wrong we arrived around 10pm and there was nobody at the entrance to open the door or greet. The clerk at the reception advised that unfortunately there was no bellboy at this time to help us with the luggage. The corridors and the rooms are terribly tired. The buffet breakfast was good but one morning there was a mouse walking around the breakfast restaurant and the staff was trying to chase him but after a while they gave up and started making fun of this "irrealistic" situation...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Rooms fantastic, Staff Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Nelly P
Reviews.Content: I stayed last friday and saturday at the park plaza victoria and I am satisfied with my stay at the hotel. The hotelstaff were very friendly. Especially the Concierge staff and the night staff. It was my first time in amsterdam, and I didn't know what are the best places to go out. The guy who was working at night recommanded me a very good club, and he arranged a guestlist for me for free entrance :D , I was very happy with that. I will definetily come here next time. Best Regards N. McCartey

Reviews.Title: “location location location!”
Reviews.Author: ulsterwolf545
Reviews.Content: wonderful location with very comfortable rooms and fabulous staff especially the concierge! asked for and got a complimentry upgrade to executive suite with king size bed! only criticism was that the service in the brasserie was poor!

Reviews.Title: “Don't let them fob you off.”
Reviews.Author: Ryan B
Reviews.Content: For my 40th, my wife booked a couple nights stay at this hotel. We arrived only to be told that they were fully booked but we could stay at their sister hotel, upgraded to a suite and the taxi paid for. They also gave us the option of coming back the next day and staying in the suite we were supposed to be in, again no taxi expense. Much to our dismay we agreed to this, knowing that something was amiss as we were being driven further outside of the city and the taxi driver said it was another 10-15 minutes away! We asked the driver to stop and to get in touch with the hotel and to tell them we were not happy. After returing to the hotel we explained that it wasn't good enough as we had spent more time in the taxi than we did on the train from the airport! The reception staff seemed to be put out by all of this and not once we were offered an apology, even after checking out. They soon found a room but it wasn't the suite we paid for but the suite was available the next day, which we moved to without hesitation as the level of hygiene in the room was disgraceful. Outside the room, smelt as if someone had defacted and the smell inside was atrocious and the carpet hadn't been introduced to a hoover in sometime as there was a nail clipping next to the bed, nice. Once we moved to the suite, we had no complaints and we have none with Amsterdam but the hotel left us with a sour taste. Reflecting back, the taxi driver said they had probably sold our room as they had one of their busiest weekends, so even he knew why we were fobbed off!

Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: Harish P
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very convenient as it is right opposite to the Amsterdam Centraal station and in the middle of all Amsterdam attractions. The room is decent but though we are a couple we were provided with two single beds. The itinerary clearly mentioned 1 queen bed but we were not provided that. Also the bathroom had just shower and not a bath tub. We haven't tried the food at the hotel as it is a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “nightshift sucks”
Reviews.Author: fcb4life
Reviews.Content: Value was ok, rooms were ok, but the staff was pretty rude. Some staffmembers were nice, but the nightshift was very rude. Especially the somalian guy. He even yelled at me. Will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location/Quality Option In Central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: PietroMorrizio
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at the Park Plaza Victoria Amsterdam (aka - Hotel Victoria) on two occasions, and would chose this hotel if I am looking for a great quality hotel option in central Amsterdam. It is very hard to beat the location - right on the corner of Prins Hendrikkade & The Damrak, and right across from the historic Centraal Station (train), the hotel is right by several canal tour options, about a ten minute walk from Dam Square (Madame Tussauds) in one direction, and about the same to Ann Frank's House, located on Prinsengracht (near Westermarkt). It is less than ten minutes walk to Amsterdam's red light district. On my first trip, the room was quite nice, but on the second trip, I got an upgrade to the suite, as I had to book on short notice after missing a flight to Berlin and being holed up in Amsterdam for a day. That was great - I had a living room, then climbed some stairs to the bedroom, which was right at the top of the building with probably the best view of the canal & Amsterdam Centraal that money can buy. The hotel is old and has very beautiful decor. I had a breakfast of scrambled egg & toast, which was on-order rather than a buffet. It's a very handy hotel if you are looking to use the train to go to either Schipol Airport, or heading out of town (either in Holland, Belgium or France). It takes about 20 minutes from the platform at Centraal Station to get to Schipol Airport, which is quite a way from Amsterdam. It is also great that you exit the hotel and are right on The Damrak, which seems to be the main thoroughfare for foot traffic & shoppers in Amsterdam. There are a string of reasonably good restaurants along The Damrak, and if you head in the direction of the Nieuwmarkt, you will almost certainly pass through part of the red light district, which is a real eye-opener, especially at night. While there are other hotels in the immediate vicinity, I just think this one is a lovely old hotel that is the best in terms of the location/quality ratio. Holland is the kind of place where you really have to pay to get something good, so I would not hesitate to pick this hotel again when I next go to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Definately the best choice”
Reviews.Author: lockeys
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I have stayed in this hotel and it just keeps getting better!.....I stayed in the beautiful Urban Wing which has the most comfortable beds ever!!! I got a great 3 night deal by shopping about and this included breakfast.....breakfast of which had a banquet of a spread to suit everyone.....lovely refreshing swimming pool for start of the day dip and staff were extremely friendly.....location of this hotel is super....2 mins walk from central train station and 5 mins from red light district and surperb canal walks....lots of shops at hand also.....

Reviews.Title: “agood choice i made”
Reviews.Author: pamela s Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: would recomend to a frend it was a very nice hotel people worked there were very help full and plesent would come back again

Reviews.Title: “Very central in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Danes55
Reviews.Content: Arriving in Shiphol Airport, 1 floor down and buy train to Amsterdam Central and 5 minuts walk later you can check in in Hotel Viktoria ,fantastic. Very good location from were you can walk to most of the interesting points in central Amsterdam. Smilling and proffesionel stafff do welcome you in the reception. If you stay there ask for rooms in the new part of the hotel , over the " bridge" they are larger and more modern, you have to use 2 different elevators but its worth to take. In the old part rooms a smaler and old, but they have startet to renovate the rooms an the resultat is VERY good, but numbers is limited, but they are modern and very comfetabel this counts for the bed and bathroom and the room in general. Easy to find restaurants close to the hotel, but try the restaurant in Viktoria also, good food and staff also very good. Do visit the very modern bar with good drinks and beer and again the staff is just doing a very good job. Breakfast in the morning is ok and with alot of option, but i do find it a bit overpriced(24,00 Euro). Total a very good hotel and the manager must be proud to have this staff , all of them are very good and i will for sure stay at this hotel agian as i have many times in the past. Use the hotel for holiday or business.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, smart and in town”
Reviews.Author: Lewis737
Reviews.Content: Directly opposite the Central Station (rail) and right at the beginning of the Damrak (main street) All hotels in Amsterdam are small due to the nature of the buildings and history. However the Victoria Park Plaza has extended through in the next door building and created the Urban Wing. Smart and modern rooms, adequate size, and with a view of the beautiful CS (central station) The trams do make noise as they pass, but that Amsterdam !! Very friendly and efficient staff.. I recommend this hotel, can't really fault it !

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking Boat Rides Just Steps From The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bridgebysue
Reviews.Content: Took the high speed line from Rotterdam to Amsterdam and walked outside to find our hotel, Park Plaza Victoria right before our eyes! Loved the hotel. Food was great. Service was exceptional. Rooms were ultra modern and so quiet!! Beds and pillows were wonderful. Cab service to the airport was so fast and very scenic BUT dont miss the great boat rides directly in front of the Hotel. They take you through all the canals to the quaintest parts of Amsterdam and you get to see it all! After that, it is just a few blocks to the oldest building in Amsterdam the Old Church. See how the people buried their dear in the church under huge marble slabs on the floor. Many famous names! Wonderful trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. A good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Can C
Reviews.Content: A great location right accross train station. Meters away from Damtrak and just a short walk from Dam Square. Rooms looking towards the main street are a little noisy though. Hotel is actually spread over a couple of building so it might feel like you are walking thru a maze to find your room. Definitely a good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent”
Reviews.Author: Cmonica
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel a few years ago and choose it for it's location.it is very close to Amsterdam central station.we were pleasantly surprised to find that it had been renovated and was looking absolutely lovely.the lobby looked so clean and well kept and check in was very quick and painless.our room in the urban wing was lovely with excellent lighting and furnishings.staff were very friendly and helpful.the only disappointment was the small pool in the fitness centre.apart from that however I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to have a comfortable pleasant base from which to explore this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and refurb”
Reviews.Author: aussietraveler56
Reviews.Content: New urban rooms look great, as per usual fantastic breakfast and excellent location especially for the RLD

Reviews.Title: “Good location but be aware of upfront charges”
Reviews.Author: ma_admin
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel to find a very helpful concierge who helped us with our luggage with a smile. We were however shocked to find that the hotel put a hold on our credit card for EUR1,000 for a stay of 4 nights with a bill totaling just over EUR500 When asked, they claimed to have placed upfront charges to cover breakfast which due to it being far too expensive, we never used. They also claimed to have mistakenly claimed for 5 nights instead of 4 but a correction was never offered. The room was clean but very small. The bathroom was so small that there was no room for essentials, toiletries etc. Location is excellent if you plan on a train trip the next morning but the downside of that location was endless piles of rubbish outside and hordes of drunks and other shady characters from the nearby Red Light Districts. Each morning, we would find hotel staff hosing the rubbish of the hotel steps with the fire hose, something we have never seen before.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Rudolph2011
Reviews.Content: We went for only two days from London to Amsterdam, the hotel staff was very charming, whe temperature was pretty nice inside of the hotel, outside was cold!!! The old wing was very traditional and has the spirit of europe, we traveled from overseas and was nice to get a nice room, good view to centraal station, and perfectly located to walk and board the tram in the city. It was a great experience. I had been in some others hotels of this chain in U.K. And they were good but this is great! As an additional tip for travelers via london- brussels- amsterdam is to consider the time you use in the security check point in bruseels when back to UK, if you are in a rush you can miss eurostar. So take your time, and use midi- suid exit in brusels not Cantral! ( midi in french is the one in the middle but not in this case) . Maybe fkying is a better deal to maximise your time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Macutter555
Reviews.Content: + good hotel great place to stay. Friendly staff I have stay in Amsterdam and this is the best hotel I have stayed at and would come back to.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: john h Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, great location, fantastic staff. The only faults: 1. The advertised free wi-fi was difficult to access. No insructions were available; you have to figure it out for yourself! They obviously want you to pay 4 euros 50 per hour to access the internet via their flat screen TV rather than free wi-fi on your own laptop! 2. There is no justification for charging 24 euros for a continental breakfast. We went round the corner to a small cafe and got a great cooked breakfast for 6:50.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Yiota K
Reviews.Content: The overall experience was excellent. The hotel is very stylish and modern and the staff very helpful. It is conveniently located just opposit Amsterdam Centraal Train (rail) Station (which is 15 minutes fron Schipol Airport) and also a Tram Station. The location is very central which makes it easy to walk around Amsterdam centre. The rooms were cleaned daily and were generally in a very good condition. The beds were very relaxing. I would love to stay there again and would definitely reccomend it to people I know.

Reviews.Title: “close to main rail station”
Reviews.Author: JuliaPv
Reviews.Content: Location close to main rail station and hotel within sight on exiting the rail station. Only a few minutes walk to the lobby entry. We had an upstairs room in the new wing and it was quiet, spacious, and clean. Bathroom facilities clean and bright. The buffet breakfasts were excellent & compared with many was reasonable value at 13 Euro. We would stay here again without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “City Centre Location a saving grace”
Reviews.Author: Neil R
Reviews.Content: Travelling in Amsterdam for business and the location of this hotel opposite Centraal Station means it's very easy to get to, has all local transport types close by and has Amsterdam literally on your doorstep. However, the quality of the hotel was very, very poor. The Spa/Pool was not open on the first day I arrived, TV and entertainment system did not work and the food in the restaurant was very poor. The staff appeared sorry for this, but juding by other reviews it is clear customer service is not high on the agenda. Very dissapointing!

Reviews.Title: “More Cons than pros for us, would not return.”
Reviews.Author: VivecaSingapore
Reviews.Content: What's Good? Location only. Good things about the hotel: 1) The concierges are fabulous - pro active, hands on & make the hotel the success it is. They were wonderful. 2) Brasserie does a good range of value for money & delicious food. 3)The urban suite, we were eventually given, was lovely. What's not so good? 1) Wrong room assignment After booking via booking.com I contacted the hotel direct to request an upgrade to the Urban Suite etc which was confirmed by email. Upon arrival - we were assigned one room - and told to come back in two hours to be given the key cards. I told them they were assigning the wrong room as I had upgraded to an Urban junior suite - They refused this - and told me I had originally booked a twin room and they had kindly upgraded it to a king double (twin beds to a king bed is an upgrade??). Upon returning after the 2 hours wait...we were assigned another room...despite my protests we were taken to the Victoria wing - and taken to an awful room! I immediately phoned reception & insisted there had been a mistake. Such a bad first impression of a hotel. 2) No early check in option We arrived at 10am - and had to wait for the full 2 hours to get to a room. 3) We were assigned 3 rooms in total (before we could settle in), 1 room upon arrival (which we never saw), another when we went back to collect the keys - and another when I complained it wasn't the room I had upgraded to and already paid for. The reception staff were reluctant to move us and I had to prove from a printed email - that I had a confirmed upgrade. It made me feel awful - as it was a birthday trip - and none of the careful pre arrangements had been carried out (e.g. birthday card, VIP treatment). 3) Reception staff were decidedly unfriendly & disbelieving to the point where we avoided the reception totally. 4) Hotel cards to door didnt work on several occasions - where we had been accidentally checked out several times (by the system??) before our booking was over (meaning the room hadn't been cleaned either). 5) Cleaning staff say 'House keeping...' and enter your room anyway (even if you call out to say you are there) ...we were caught in bed on several occasions (early in the morning)...felt our privacy was invaded and we were always listening for the door to open! 6) We were overcharged (on our credit card) and had already paid for the room via the hotel booking group before we arrived but were told we hadnt been charged and had to a room deposit - then had to pay again on departure - at a completely different rate. We had to contact the hotel upon our return home and make a case for them to investigate their error and refund us the difference. All in all - would not return here again...

Reviews.Title: “don't waste your time or money”
Reviews.Author: Rabbitmoondancer
Reviews.Content: I arrived today and was very happy to have the early checking ready. The room was very small, but not bad. However, I am here for 5 days on business and was going to just stay here the entire trip, but now I can't wait to leave. I paid for high speed wifi that is horrible and now I have been sitting at my dinner table for near 1.5 hours with no one saying anything to me. This is unacceptable service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely base for a stay in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: Lizbob77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in January. Stayed in a lovely room in the older part if the hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful- couldn't fault it except the cooked items at breakfast were cold. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of hidden charge!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jev_jevio
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with my girlfriend in November everything was lovely so I thought I would return with my friend in Febuary. Checked in the same as last time, then was told we were told we had to put a â‚¬75 euro deposit on the room on a credit card wich I didnt have to do before then when we checked out we only got back â‚¬68 euros back in cash and was told it was down to a local tax not receiving the full amout back??? Then by the time i changed it back into sterling I was very out of pocket. Very dissapointed as the room was lovely and paid for before hand and I was not going to use the mini bar etc and thought it was a way for them to con extra money out of me. I dont appreciate being ripped off!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoJo_5666 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I only have great things to say about this hotel. I really enjoyed my stay here and highly recommend it for anyone visiting Amsterdam. This was my first time visiting and so I wasnt sure which hotel to go for and this hotel was recommended to me. When I arrived I was pleased with how nice and clean it was. Also for the price it wasnt what I expected... It was better than I expected! The service from the staff in reception was fantastic, they will help in any way they can and are really pleasant and friendly. The room (I didnt stay in the urban wing) was really clean and modern. The location was perfect, literally all the places you would want to visit as a tourist are in walking distance. 10 out of 10 from us!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with nice staff but...”
Reviews.Author: UnTjus
Reviews.Content: We stay at Park Plaza Victoria Hotel i february 2012. We got a room in the old part of the hotel, where they about to renovated the outside of the hotel. The room was very small and there was no space around the bed. You could only get in and out of bed from one side or from the end of the bed. The bed was a small dobbeltbed, the bathroom was almost bigger than the rest of the room. The bathroom was nice, it has a bathtub and nice appliences. There was noise from the streets wich might have been prevented with soundprooved windows. We found the bed to small and we asked the staff for a different room, wich they gave us the next day. We were mooved with no trouble, they even mooved our luggage for us. We were mooved to the new part of the hotel, where the room are bigger and newly renovated. The new room was very nice, the decour was great and the bed was bigger and cosy. Brand new bathroom without a bathtub and they have a huge shower. Short period af free internet, otherwise You must pay for more. Breakfast - they charge 24 euro for breakfast wich is a bit much. If You choose breakfast, order Your eggs freshly cooked. All in all a nice stay. Thanks to the friendly staff...!

Reviews.Title: “Fully recommended”
Reviews.Author: Mikeep69
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights (Friday & Saturday) and were totally happy. The room was booked through a comparison site, so we knew we had a good deal, and it reached expectations. We arrived early and way before check in (around 11:30) and was pleasantly surprised when told our room was ready. They kindly gave us an upgrade without asking (thank you), although we did book 3 or 4 weeks earlier. The male receptionist was very polite, helpful and welcoming. The room (Executive double) was lovely. It was very clean, well furnished and had everything we expect from a 4 star hotel (except no bath robes). The TV already had a welcome message on it and had enough English channels should you wish to watch TV. They provided a nice range of toiletries and the small toothbrushes and paste was an unusual extra touch. Despite being on the front it was quiet with very light noise heard from outside The hotel is ideally located as only a 5 minute or less walk from Central Station. The outside currently has some work being done on it so it does not look as good as it is inside. We paid Â£130 per night for the 2 nights and it was good value for money, although breakfast was not included and was expensive at over 20 euros. Overall, a lovely stay, I would certainly return if a good deal was available and the Park Plaza Victoria, Amsterdam, is fully recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sian J Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very well maintained hotel, with excellent facilities. Conveniently situated opposite the central station, and within easy walking distance to most of Amsterdam's main attractions. Be careful when you order breakfast though, ours was Â£20 per head - although very tasty and plenty of it. Â£20 each for breakfast is expensive!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: hilarytravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights with 2 teenagers in adjoining rooms in the urban wing. The rooms were deceptively spacious by clever use of a mirrored wall and the bed very comfortable. The staff were helpful and friendly. I am surprised to read the recent negative reviews as these do not equate with our experience. The room was cleaned but late in the day. The location is ideal for sightseeing - most well known landmarks were within walking distance save for the Museumplein which was an easy tram ride from outside the hotel. We did not eat at the hotel save for a mouthwatering walnut ice cream in the lounge! but noticed that the Brasserie served breakfasts of varying reasonably cheap prices (for those who have criticised the hotel restaurant breakfast prices). The car parking service was excellent - the car being taken away from outside the hotel and returned at the appointed time. Two criticisms - firstly arriving late in the day we went to a Chinese restaurant recommended by the conceirge who booked us a table. It was very bland meal in a dull restaurant and we discovered the next day that it was only a few hundred yards further to Chinatown with a number of interesting and highly reviewed restaurants. Secondly, the swimming pool in the hotel was an asset travelling with teenagers. It was one of the reasons we chose this hotel. The pool was fine but there was an extra charge per person of 10 euros for use every time of the sauna and steam room. This was a highly expensive extra and in my view unwarranted - a great pity.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: terene b Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've been to Amsterdam several times before and this hotel was definitely the best I've stayed in! The rooms were lovely and clean, quiet and spacious with big soft comfy beds. The shower was hot and the room included lots of nice little extras which none of the other Amsterdam hotels I've used previously provided such as toiletries (shampoo, soap etc) free tea/coffee making facilities, iron, and TV with English channels ie BBC1, 2 and ITV. The location of the hotel is pretty central for most things although it's easy enough to get a taxi if your legs are getting weary and the hotel was probably about Â£20 per night more expensive than some of the other hotels I've used here but the extra Â£20 was well worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Aggressive management PLS READ & poor quality rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rex B
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel as it was central to transport links for a 5 day conference. We are both professional people & travel many hotels & to AMS pretty much every month however I WOULD NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN! We checked in & was given our room key for the next 5 days, the room had a strong odour of stale cigarettes, I rang reception who changed our room to the Urban suite. The suite is too dark & difficult to get ready, it is several lifts & stairs away from the exit of the hotel & the kettle was disgusting I really do think someone urinated in it. Housekeeping changed the kettle & agreed it had a bad smell!! Our room was not cleaned for the entire time we stayed there, i am not sure if they just missed us from the rota & as we out during the days, I had to ring reception for fresh towels & milk etc on day 3 but still no cleaning!! During our stay all front desk staff we nice & helpful but upon check out we were told the manager wanted to speak with us. we were confronted by Christina B (who is actually only the Human resources manager ) & her part time security officers. They claimed we had left biscuit crumbs on the floor, maybe smoked??!! & the room was in such a mess that they wanted to charge us 300euro for additional cleaning, huh maybe the bins were full because our room was never cleaned, my wife & i were outraged at her accusations that we lived in a her words "nasty " way. We felt very intimidated by the approach & my wife was shocked with her attitude & lack of class. They could not charge as nothing, we completely refused nothing was damaged, nothing was moved about, no one had smoked in fact the room was fine apart from it looked like someone had stayed there 5 days without a cleaner & for this they ruined our time away & made us feel threatened, confused & unhappy after spending nearly Â£1,000.00 with Park Plaza Victoria, well done !

Reviews.Title: “Good location wrong Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, it was a shame about the room though as it was very dark and dreary, not at all what the Web pages had shown, we had booked a Superior room which this most definitely was not. We loved Amsterdam, can recommend the De Prins eetcafe on the Princengracht it is wonderful ,with lovely home made foods, recommend the soups, especially pea & ham, Train service is excellent from Schipol Aiport 15 mins Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, well run, clean and well placed”
Reviews.Author: dtSurrey
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a 3 day Business trip, this is my second stay at the hotel, both experiences have been good. The staff were friendly efficient and helpful. The hotel has a very good quality bistro type restaurant that does some very nice food. It has a separate bar area, an internet room and large waiting area away from the front desk. The hotel has over 300 bedrooms. The one I had was spacious well appointed, clean and comfortable with 3 easy chairs, a work area with high speed broadband at E4.50 a day or free Wifi for the casual user. The room had a 32" HD Phillips TV with multiple channels some in HD including UK bbc, itv and Ch4. Breakfast was a well presented buffet style with a large choice to suit all needs. There is a cab rank outside the front and the main subway and train station is only 100 yards away (No noise heard from room). Water taxi's are 50 yards away and the tram station about the same distance. This is a good hotel in a central area close to amenities and attractions. I would stay here again. Taxi's are quite expensive and the drivers only seem to know all the long routes? In contrast a Tram costs E2.50 from Central Station along Damrak as for as The Heineken Brewery at Weteringlaan a journey of about 4km. For those visiting Amsterdam for the first time the train runs from Schipol airport every 15 minutes takes about 20 -25 mins and costs around E4.30 and well worth doing. For a day out the hop on hop off bus tour for E18.00 is worth the experience. Most of the canals were frozen over when I was there and skaters could be seen all times of day and night. Hope you enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Snow outside, warm inside.”
Reviews.Author: rooboy68
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my 5 days in snowy Amsterdam at this hotel. The concierge were fantastic organising restaurant bookings and other things. Strangely though, three mornings (out of five) I asked the waiter for fried eggs and ham and on two occasions got an omlette instead. Nothing really to complain about as the omlette was delicious, maybe just a communication issue with the waitstaff? The urban room was great, take advantage of the "upgrade at check in" if it's offered. Take the train from Schiphol, the hotel is right across the road from the station.

Reviews.Title: “Center located Hotel with nice rooms, but”
Reviews.Author: Darbuka
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Park Plaza Amsterdam end of January during ISE confrens at RAI. I asked for a quiet room and was very pleased to find my self in room 420. No disturbing noises at all, Great ! Breakfast was special offered for 19 Euro. It was ok but nothing to compare to those where you can order omelet on the spot and chef will make to your order. Breakfast was "extended" version of British Breakfast. You can start your day with it but as Simon Cowell says the WAU factor was missing. Biggest issue in this hotel is very dirty carpets on the hallway and floors. Somehow dirty carpet's are in my mind all the time after staying in this place.

Reviews.Title: “TV not working”
Reviews.Author: shah28
Reviews.Content: TV was not working in the room and the front desk can't do anything much.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & accessible”
Reviews.Author: TopsMA
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel, great location opposite the station. Despite other reviews the staff seemed very pleasant & helpful. I ate in the restaurant alone one evening & the staff were very attentive. The bar staff also, although busy, were very courteous & efficient. Our room was very comfortable & quiet, with plenty of space. My only complaint is, given the quality of the hotel generally, the bath towels are unreasonably small & not at all fluffy!

Reviews.Title: “Spot on!”
Reviews.Author: Jo R
Reviews.Content: I am surprised to read poor reviews regarding the staff at the Victoria Plaza because we arrived back yesterday from a 4 night stay there, and found them to be amongst the most courteous and helpful hotel staff we've encountered anywhere ever! There is a sign in the lobby toilet asking for 50c from non guests so clearly they are allowed to use it, they just pay for the privilege. (We saw several other hotels advising outsiders that the loos were for the use of the hotel guests only so it's not uncommon). One night a man followed us into the lobby and asked us for cannabis and the staff surrounded him and ushered him out very quickly which was reassuring. The lobby staff went to great lengths to offer advice on tours trips etc. However we did buy canal boat tickets in the hotel at what was claimed to be a discounted rate, and one couple in our party found it â‚¬2.5 cheaper per person to turn up at the dock but the staff member in question was so nice we didn't begrudge him a couple of euros commission! The hotel is in two halves, classic and urban. We were given a classic room (which was quite large clean etc) but we upgraded to a suite on the urban side which was more modern and stylish. Separate sitting room, extra tv, expresso coffee maker and 7 foot bed with memory foam matress topper, lovely! There was a bottle of water which we presumed to be complimentary which we drank, and it appeared on the mini bar bill at the end of the stay at â‚¬6.50 so watch out for that! The hotel is perfectly situated as most other reviewers have already mentioned. We took a train from Schipol Airport (3 stops) and exiting the station, the hotel is directly opposite and only about 2 minute suit-case drag! We had breakfast one morning in the Seasons Restaurant which was all good if a little on the pricey side at â‚¬25. Plenty of places nearby to eat brekkie for under â‚¬10. Staff will happily mind your luggage on departure day if you're not leaving Amsterdam until after check out time. I would stay again, this hotel is well run and efficient, our experience of the staff was overwhelmingly positive... but there is a recession on and understandably they're not 'giving' things away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SophieJayy
Reviews.Content: I went to Amsterdam for my 21st and had an excellent time. Alot of people put me off going but i couldnt of asked for a nicer weekend. The hotel was great and the staff were very friendly! We booked for a standard room but we upgraded once we got there to an executive room, as it was my birthday they kindly offered me a suite for the same price but the executive room was fine for us especially as it had a balcony! This has to be the best hotel in Amsterdam for location - opposite the central station! Once you walk out the hotel you could go left for the coffee shops and right for the main strip and the red light district! The hotel wa quite pricey for food but its well worth it. The food was delicious! We enquired about the best place to go for a curry and the man at the stand in reception recommended a place called GHANDI .. we went and it looked quite shabby but it was one of the nicest curries id ever had. We had a great weekend and will definateley be returning to the hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Park Plaza standard:-)”
Reviews.Author: NATinCPH
Reviews.Content: Either I am lucky or the Park Plazas deliver just when I visit them. Very good location, clean rooms, such polite and nice staff, very professional as well, managed the whole big hall full of guests checking out, organized trips leaving for the day, running teams preparing for some marathon or other smoothly and with a smile. The only issue I had was that the reception had no spare mobile phone chargers at all. I would expect the hotel of their standard to have that covered.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nsross
Reviews.Content: great room in the urban wing,had a great shower,good bar and the bar next to the hotel was owned by the hotel and probably 1 of the cheapest places to drink in Amsterdam,

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Historic building”
Reviews.Author: Passed50
Reviews.Content: You can tell this hotel has historic roots. Old decorations, tight corridors. They also have a modern section. Room was clean and spacious. Helpful and forthcoming staff. Courtious and informtive Conciege. No problems recommending this hotel Location right next to the Central Station and main tram lines; very practical.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TessBless
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated just across the road from the main train station which is a short and cheap train journey from Schipol airport so location is second to none. Rooms are a very high standard. Food (at a company dinner hosted at the hotel) was very good and breakfast offered a great selection. The only slight let down was the leisure centre. Very small pool and gym plus a sauna but no jacuzzi so not much fun for leisure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam for the New Year Celebrations”
Reviews.Author: figsteruk1
Reviews.Content: We like this Hotel for it's convenience to the Central Train Station. You can hop on a high speed train from the Airport, and be in your hotel room within half an hour, exactly what we wanted. The reception staff were brilliant and couldn't have been more helpful. The cafe was nice, and a good spot for a bit of people watching (although they come in herds straight off the train). Another nice touch was the complimentary bottled water in the room.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. It has an excellent location, a short walk from the station and close to many attractions. I had an upstairs room in the new wing and it was quiet, spacious, and clean. Bathroom facilities clean and bright. The wifi connection is free for all guests. Breakfast was also excellent but expensive. Poor air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Location for the Train Station!”
Reviews.Author: BES59
Reviews.Content: My husband travels to Amsterdam about every other month and this Hotel is going to be his stop. It is all refurbished with beautiful decor. The reception was very friendly and everyone very helpful. Our room was very nice, large room for Amsterdam, and very quite, over looking the back street to the shopping street. We had drinks and dinner in the cafe right on the street, very friendly staff, great soup and nice cold beer. We look forward to many stays at this hotel in the coming years.

Reviews.Title: “Victoria Hotel, Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: JTFomes
Reviews.Content: A really great hotel;only 5mins walk from Centraal Station and in the centre of all the canal rides. The "red light" area is only 200 yards away[but you'de never know it was there!!] where there are loads of great eateries-Molly Malones serves good beer and great food. The rooms are very clean and very quiet.Excellent staff. Will go again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Pudsey126
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during February half term with the children. It's just a stone's throw away from central station. We found it very easy to travel and walk to all the tourist sites like Anne Frank's House and the Van Gogh Museum taking scenic back routes along the canals. Our room was a comfortable family room and we picked up breakfast at various street cafes on route to our destination for the day. Staff were very friendly and efficient. Would definitely stay again. An added bonus next time would be free internet access !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: illusio
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for the one night in December, and was very impressed with the hotel; 1 minute walk from the central train station, the reception and concierge staff were extremely helpful and the room was excellent. Would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Some upgrading needed”
Reviews.Author: Jbps
Reviews.Content: Centrally located at the main station this hotel would need some upgrading of the rooms. There was a construction site at the hotel that was not mentionned anywhere on there websites etc. Rooms were very old fashioned and staff not very friendly and service not too good. Breakfast was good though.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: KERF_Worldwide
Reviews.Content: Well this tale deserves a write up. I have stayed a few times with The Victoria and the time before last was awful. The dreaded â€œOne foot around a single bedâ€� box room. It was a show stopper...I was never going to stay there again after that. My colleague uses TripAdvisor and had entered a review of our stay and had commented on my tiny room. To my utter surprise a couple of weeks, maybe ten days, after the event he informed me that he had received an email from Trip Advisor asking if The Victoria could contact him. They did so forthwith. It was a direct response to his review on Tripadvisor from the Hotel manager. I hadn't heard of such a thing. The lady was very apologetic and offered to upgrade us to an Urban Suite should we choose to stay with The Victoria again. We are through Amsterdam all year round on business so we took them up the offer and even the booking was personally taken care of. We arrived very early in the morning flying in from Africa. This was not a problem for the Hotel, although the rooms were not ready, as expected, they were happy to store our bags as we headed off for an important meeting. The Suite itself was fairly impressive as a Suite and for Amsterdam Central it was very very good. Massive and hugely comfortable bed, big flat screens, bright white bathroom finished well and a separate office/sitting area. All pretty new by the looks of things. Bathrobe provided which should be standard in my opinion. If I hadnâ€™t have had a free upgrade I would be complaining about the fact that Housekeeping left a big dirty scrubbing sponge on top of my jumper which was on a chair, so room for improvement. The Staff was pleasant as always, check in staff particularly nice. Location wise, if you want to be by Centraal Station then you simply canâ€™t do better. The Victoria clearly cares about its guests and their opinions, a quick read of this and the fact that every review is responded to proves that. It is most certainly not the case with the majority of hotels. They went above and beyond for us and if I am staying in the area again then I will stay there again. Location is key in Amsterdam and The Victoria is very convenient. The rooms can be mixed but the Urban Suites are pretty sweet. Most of all though, they clearly care and they clearly try very hard to keep their guests happy. I am most certainly one of them. Let us not forget that as customers who have places such as Tripadvisor to post genuine reviews should use it as it should be used. If a hotel cares then they will use Tripadvisor as the very powerful tool that it is. The Victoria clearly gets this. Other Hotels should also. Don't expect to get an upgrade if something is wrong though...this was exceptional, and the fact that we are regular customers has to be considered in also.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice service and room”
Reviews.Author: keenscarlet
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a weekend away, got an early check-in, great tips from the concierge and a clean comfortable room. Breakfast not great so avoid that if its optional.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for short stopovers”
Reviews.Author: smile81
Reviews.Content: Had a stopover in Amsterdam whilst on a business trip and spent the night at this hotel. The location is really great when you have limited time in the city, as it is situated in the city centre right across the train station. I got a room in the new part of the hotel, and was really happy with it - clean and quite spacious. Front staff friendly and polite, check-in and check-out were quick and problem free. Recommended, I will definitely stay here again on my next stopover :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for an Amsterdam weekend”
Reviews.Author: CostinN
Reviews.Content: For 3 days in Amsterdam this is a very good hotel, conveniently located near the Centraal Station, the Maritime Museum, the Old Church, the Dam, the Red District, and the shopping areas. Rooms (I stayed in 659) are relatively large by Amsterdam standards, though poorly lit. Breakfast was superb!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: Georgeemadarmanious
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right infront of the central rail station in amsterdam. The location is more than perfect. The hotel is very clean and comfortable. The rooms are nice. May be the staff are not very friendly but overall they are not bad. I would definitely choose this hotel if i visit amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Brasserie, quirky room”
Reviews.Author: BlackAmber
Reviews.Content: The hotel is the first thing you see as you emerge from the Central Station so it's conveniently located for the canal hop-on hop-off water bus and the trams as well being at one end of Amsterdam's main shopping street. Take extreme care crossing the street. The cyclists don't take prisoners! The main bar, near Reception, was only open from 17:00 to 01:00 during our stay. The other bar, next door to the Brasserie, was open intermittently but you can order a drink in the Brasserie itself. My experience of the hotel was that the bar, concierge and Brasserie staff were truly excellent. Housekeeping left a lot to be desired though. In the evening the Brasserie is set up for two different types of service. The tables in the area by the windows are set out with linen tablecloths, silverware and an array of glasses. If you sit here they give you the dinner menu - not extensive but the dishes we had were very good. In the darker section of the Brasserie the seating is more casual as is the menu. This is the place to have breakfast. On the first morning for â‚¬12.50 I had a platter with six slices of yellow cheese, a wedge of brie, two slices of ham, two slices of chicken breast and one slice of roast beef with a hard-boiled egg, a fruit yogurt, a basket of bread and croissants, orange juice (it tasted freshly squeezed) and the coffee of my choice Much better value than the buffet breakfast in the other restaurant - this I understand was â‚¬23. I ate breakfast in the Brasserie every day and although the items on the platter varied it was always excellent value for money - enough for two people unless you are very hungry. The hotel has two sections - turn right when you enter for the Urban wing and left for the Victoria wing. The former has been newly refurbished with red and black funky decor. The latter is well past its best with brown/beige rather grubby, and in some places smelly, carpets. Our room (number 231) was quirky. You'd either love it or hate it. It was on two levels. The lower level included the bathroom and a large, but not very comfortably furnished, sitting room with the most appalling lighting I've ever experienced in a hotel. We asked one of the staff who delivered room service to send us up another lamp of some kind as we couldn't see to prepare paperwork for our conference. The lamp never materialised. We had to have the TV switched on to provide additional lighting. The room is built into the eves of one of the bits of the hotel that extend outwards from the main block. To get to the bedroom we had to climb a really steep staircase - more like a ladder really. There was no light over the staircase. I suspect this would fail a health and safety inspection in the UK. We had to position the standard lamp to illuminate the bottom of the stairs and leave it on all night in case we needed to come down to the bathroom in the dark. This meant we had light spillage upwards into the bedroom loft space. The bed was two metres wide which was very nice but there was so little space around it you had to walk sideways to get into bed whilst trying not to bump your head on the beams. There was a strange wheel with sharp spikes in the roof space over the sitting room. Lots of beams - you'd have thought they could have fixed a light to one of them. The only lighting downstairs was the ceiling lamp in the entrance hallway, a small desk lamp and the standard lamp in the corner of the room. No light over the sofa or coffee table or in the wardrobe. The sofa was hard and not at all comfortable. When we arrived (late at night) the room was freezing. In the dark we didn't notice the low radiator under the bottom of the curtains so tried to generate heat with what turned out to be the airconditioning controls. Turning it up to 23.5 C made no difference whatsoever. Of course, we found the radiator in the morning when we opened all the curtains. You'd have thought housekeeping could have left the radiators on setting 2 or 3 rather than the snowflake setting when they made up the room. On which subject, in a six day stay our room was serviced only once without prompting. We tried taking the do-not-distrub sign off the door when we left our room around nine - the room wasn't serviced. The next day we turned the sign around to the please-clean-my-room side - the room wasn't serviced. I had been reluctant to use this sign as it was the same colour on both sides and I feared the housekeeping staff would at a quick glance think we were displaying the do-not-disturb sign. I had to ring housekeeping at around 15:00 each day to get them to service the room after we'd been out all day since around nine. I asked for an extra duvet the first morning because we had been too cold to sleep the first night. They failed to provide one. I used one of the pillows as a cushion on the chair downstairs expecting they would provide another pillow upstairs but no such luck. I might stay here again but only in the Urban wing and I'd go straight to the general manager over any housekeeping issues next time. I really wanted to rate the hotel three and a half rather than three. It doesn't deserve a four.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, prime location”
Reviews.Author: ChuckandNeil
Reviews.Content: We ended up booking this hotel after we arrived in Amsterdam. Our room was spacious, clean, contemporary and SURPRISINGLY QUIET! This hotel is located right across from Centraal Station, but you wouldn't know it. The staff were only too happy to help. I would definitely stay here again. A little pricey, but hey, its vacation.

Reviews.Title: “another one bites the dust”
Reviews.Author: martin w
Reviews.Content: Nice enough on the face of it. Lovely old building right across the road from Centraal rail station, on the corner of Damrak in Centrum. The public areas are very good but my room on the fifth floor was a bit small for a 4 star hotel. The fittings were ok: the bed reasonably comfortable, the shower good. The downstairs bar is clean, comfortable, with an attentive barman. However this bar had no French wine at all. Not a bottle â€“I asked him to check. Alright if you like Chilean wine, I suppose; but I donâ€™t. Didnâ€™t eat here so no idea about the food. The concierge and other front of house folks are great. Real nightmare started next morning at about 0745hrs. Powercut to the building. The member of staff I spoke to said â€œIt happens sometimesâ€�. A powercut means no showers, no heating, no lifts. And of course no lights other than emergency lighting in the public areas. Packing in the dark is a bit tricky. The key card works, the safe works; but no lifts is serious. Some of the guests are elderly or infirm and canâ€™t reasonably be expected to walk up several flights of stairs. The hotel, it seems, has no back up generator, even though â€œit happens sometimesâ€�. This hotel is alright; but no better than that.

Reviews.Title: “One night in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: dinsdaleAB
Reviews.Content: On a short business trip to the Netherlands I was fortunate enough to spend my last night in his hotel. The location is convenient with all the transportation literally outside the front of the hotel. The staff are friendly, the room was very clean and quiet, the bed was comfortable and the breakfast was delicious. I would have loved to extend my trip by a day or two just to experience more of the hotel and city of Amsterdam. I will return and bring my wife so we can both enjoy using this hotel as our vacation accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go...”
Reviews.Author: Levystar
Reviews.Content: Location seems ok - but area is quite shady. Hotel looks very old from outside (Amsterdam's oldest) - and it is. On my first morning, city light went out - and they did not even have a back up generator. Even in new wing, things (heater, tv, AC) does not really work that well or are very noisy. Gym is ok - but not for free (15â‚¬/workout) Bed looks new and nice - but are to short. Roomservice works far from good - do not order Green Curry Chicken; you will only dried cooked meat, white rice and 5 beans - no cravy curry sauce. So I cannot wait to go home and never come back to this place...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: jwfhunts
Reviews.Content: This hotel, directly opposite Central station is in a great location to all transport links. The hotel is spotlessly clean with friendly, attentive and knowledgeable staff. Bedrooms are extremely comfortable, spacious with excellent towels and toiletries. There is plenty of hot water. In the morning there is an excellent breakfast buffet and it is pleasing to see a hotel that has the vision to alter the breakfast hours at weekends for leisure guests. Unfortunately the hot buffet items were not hot on any of the three mornings that i stayed at the hotel which was a disappointment. On advising staff, they did "stir the contents" of the silver dishes in an effort to circulate heat but it just did not work.. Would I stay here again - Yes - for the convenience, friendliness of staff and comfort of the hotel in general.

Reviews.Title: “From disappointment to thankfulness”
Reviews.Author: eandmb
Reviews.Content: A few days before leaving for our river cruise departing from Amsterdam we were told that our hotel had been changed from the Movenpick near the dock to the Park Plaza Victoria. Never having been to Amsterdam I knew that the original reservation was near the city and nearer to the dock. I had no idea that the change would be so much better. Being across the street from the train station was an easy train ride from the airport and a walk across the street to the hotel. The location is ideal for walking to the red light district and along the canalled streets that make Amsterdam so special. There are many restaurants and bistros in the area. The hotel exterior was under renovation but that did not hamper us at all. The rooms are nice - clean and the beds comfortable - which suited us fine after an internaitonal flight. A continental breakfast was included in our stay. Since we don't spend much time in the room, location is our main criteria and this one is A-one.

Reviews.Title: “Loyal Customer, tiny room ?”
Reviews.Author: TonyTravels262
Reviews.Content: A business colleague and myself stayed here for one night late Oct. I usually stay here, but have noticed the rooms have been getting progressively smaller and tattier. I booked two double rooms, and got two single rooms, my colleagues room was a disgrace. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: kpb1nv
Reviews.Content: Worth the price for the location but shocked that they charge extra for robes and for use of the sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location in central of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: JukeVantaa
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel a month ago, and liked the room and furniture in it a lot. Only execption... the bathroom which was a far way too little for superiour class room, but really cannot say if it is per room beacause my friend have single room and he have bathroom over 3 size than me and a bathtub in it. The hotel is very centrally located, right across Amsterdam Central. There are many good restaurants and souvenir shops next to the hotel and of course, this place is near everything, like Trainstation, shopping street etc. The location of this Hotel is as good you can get if you look the Hotel in Central part of Amsterdam. The fitness center and sauna is run by a third party and is not included in the room charge. 14.50 Euros/day is far too expensive. And it only runs from 10am-10pm. Like "complimentary" water, which you can buy from room for 6,50â‚¬!. Well, it surely is ok to charge from water but, when you pay over 200â‚¬ from room i think you really should get some for free too. Internet connection (even after upgrading to business) is a littlebit slow but works guite well. Breakfast ends at 10am but there are options around the hotel if you need to eat breakfast later. Breakfast was wery nice and have a lot of different options and juices etc. Room cleaning was very good, like the service also. Fast and helpful. Ignore the scaffolding on the hotel as its under going renovation, the Hotel from inside is very nice. In short, If I've to come back with business or family, i would definitely consider this hotel as a good option. Stayed November 2011, traveled on business

Reviews.Title: “I know when to cross the road”
Reviews.Author: RoytonBrowns
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is good, comfortable. Rooms are clean and efficient - just what you need for a one night business stay. Breakfast is fine. Location is right opposite Centraal Station so perfect for getting about the city. I have stayed in this hotel a number of times on business and always found it acceptable. However, on this occasion I was put in a room overlooking the main road up to Dam Square. At first, the view was great. I could watch the comings and goings of Amsterdam's finest out of my 1st floor window. Then I noticed the sound from the road crossing beacons. Tick tick tick it counted down from 50 nice and slowly. Then the little green man came on and tocktocktock at one hundred miles an hour. And then it slowed down to tick tick tick from 50, and then the green man came on tocktocktock...you get the idea? It turns off automatically at midnight. Blissful silence. I settled down to sleep, my nerves frayed around the edges. Wonder what time it starts again. I probably nodded off around 3am expecting it to go off any minute. 6 AM !!! What an alarm call. That's 5am UK time. I arrived in the office like a zombie, tick tick tick on countdown in my head. My advice, take earplugs if staying on the first floor overlooking the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rado1986
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 1 night was excellent, room was so modern and location fantastic just next to the central station . You can walk to every attraction from there. Staff was brilliant specially reception very professional quick check in very polite. I would stay there again and reccomend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location - minor niggles”
Reviews.Author: Lepida
Reviews.Content: I remembered in a previous visit that we were always getting onto a tram to the station, as it was the starting place for so many trips etc. I also remembered the station forecourt as being very pleasant. So I though that I would choose a hotel next to the station for convenience. Well the hotel is very conveniently located for the station so no need for a taxi etc.and all trips start and end there. However with the current subway building works the station forecourt is not very pleasant. I must say that during our stay there was no noise or dirt form the building works, but the area is a bit of a mess with hoardings around a big hole in the ground. We stayed for a week on holiday. The atmosphere is very 'lively' and busy with many people rushing around either for work or play. This was too lively for a relaxing holiday. I think that for a weekend it would be ideal as the general hubbub and mess of the area didn't wear me down until about day 3. The buffet breakfast was excellent but very expensive if not included in the deal. We paid 23â‚¬. In the end we usually had coffee and a la carte breakfast in the public cafe, or there are other cafes nearby. (We tried the next door McDonalds, which as a rule is OK for breakfast, but must say the Damrak branch is not very salubrious) Immediately before we left I read reviews that said that the hotel was infested with rodents - I am happy to report that we did NOTencounter a single one. An Italialian restaurant in Damrak has a resident cat which wandered amongst the diners. In normal circumstances I might find this offputting, but in this case found it re-assuring. Re the room - it was fine. It was relatively spacious for a city centre hotel with plenty of storage space. The decor was a bit brown, but it was fine. The room was quiet and we slept well. The room servicing was interesting - we felt that the chambermaid was playing mind-games with us. On putting used towel in the bath to indicate replace it, the old one was taken away but not replaced. it got that we were scared to repeat that experience in case we ended up with no towels, so hung our used towels up to dry. Admitttedly we did get a fresh set eventually. At the start of the stay the range of toiletries was one of best I have ever seen in a hotel - including emergency toothbrushes and shavers etc. all there without having to ask. However the replacement of the said toiletries was not good. A perfectly good soap bar, used on one occasion was removed on day 2 and not replaced, ever. We switched to bath gel while it lasted, but on the final day I washed with shampoo. Despite leaving hints about the black tea situation - replacement of tea and creamer was a bit hit-and miss as well. In summary - the main reason that I wouldn't stay in this hotel again is that the location is a bit TOO lively/messy for me, and I next time I would choose somewhere a little more laid-back/neat and tidy. However the location would be absolutely ideal for someone staying for a weekend break as it is so centrally located and handy for the station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: ChrisUKinHanoi
Reviews.Content: I was only in Amsterdam overnight in advance of a flight in the morning, but decided to stay in the centre rather than out at Schiphol. Staying at Park Plaza was a very good choice for this, as it is just over the road from Amsterdam Centraal train station, so it is very conveniently placed. In addition, the surrounding area and streets are a nice setting to walk around and have a quick look into what Amsterdam is like. The hotel rooms have clearly been updated recently, with a very nice and modern feel to the rooms. They are much better than most hotel rooms in major cities in Europe these days (although European hotels have a habit of being too tired it seems). So for rooms, this is a great choice. The service here is not bad, although they need to sort out their check-out process as it takes far longer than it should. I saw on their interactive TVs that they had an e-checkout option but unfortunately that didn't seem to be working. The only other criticism is that the lift system is a bit annoying as you have to chance lifts to get to different rooms. That is a minor inconvenience I guess. I also got room service whilst I was there, and I have to say that they served the best steak that I have had in a long time. Thoroughly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, great rooms, expensive fitness center”
Reviews.Author: ArunGupta Posted by a Choicehotels traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel couple of years ago and found the refurnished rooms much better. The urban look was indeed very classy. The hotel is very centrally located, right across Amsterdam Central. There are tons of restaurants and souvenir shops next to the hotel. Several McDonalds, Burger King, and Subways if you've kids. The fitness center is run by a third party and is not included in the room charge. 14.50 Euros/day is expensive. And it only runs from 10am-10pm. Starts 7am on Friday though so worked out for me because I stayed there Thu/Fri night. Internet connection (even after upgrading to business) is a little shaky but work can be done by refreshing the pages. Breakfast ends at 10am but there are options around the hotel. Ignore the scaffolding on the hotel as its under going renovation, inside is beautiful. Hotel structure is funny as it requires you to go up a floor, cross a street using walkway, and then take the elevator to the rooms. In short, If I've to come back with family, would definitely consider this hotel as a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Dhlix
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, clean, polite reception staff. The rooms were recently refurbished. We stayed on the 7th floor, very quiet up there . Ideal location - near Dam, very close to Centraal Station. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: sean_iow
