Reviews.Content: Easy to get to from the train station (its across the road) so get train from airport not expensive taxi. The hotel is so good for location and exploring the city, the hotel is smart and clean and serves a great buffet breakfast until quite late, good for when your getting in late!

Reviews.Title: “Best city ever!”
Reviews.Author: DCLady2
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived at the trains station until I left on the plane, I was "home". This hotel is located a short walk from the train station and is perfection. The rooms are beautiful and the staff are great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: waterwillow
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience at the Park Plaza Victoria. The staff/concierge were pleasant and and helpful. Our room was in the Urban Wing and we were amazed how clean and spacious it was. the bed was roomy and very comfortable.The bathroom was also spacious and clean. We didn"t use the mini bar as it was expensive. We didn"t have time to use the pool facilities, we only stayed 1 night. Breakfast was another surprise. It was a buffet style with everything you could want. You don"t get a typical hot breakfast but scrambled egg,bacon and sausages were available. There was a good choice of cereals,fresh fruit,yoghurt,breads,cheeses,hams and juice,hot drinks. Highly recommended if you want a top class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not music to my ears”
Reviews.Author: George F
Reviews.Content: Only plus I saw is its a good Location especially if using the train. Was a little miffed that they never informed me that they put a hold on my card for $1175 for a room that ended up being $662. They were painting the hallways and the painter was SINGING outside my door at 8am!! The room I had was certainly not a 4 star room. I would give the hotel a high 2 stars at the most. Then my last night they decided to tear out the carpet in front of my door, what a lovely smell, was not immediately replaced even though the new carpet was sitting right there. A temporary carpet runner would have been better than the left over carpet pad still stuck to the floor, all night. That is not a 4 star hotel way of doing repairs. And also agree with another reviewer that the bed is real old and lumpy.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rosemarie O
Reviews.Content: Nothing was too much trouble. We found all staff very friendly and helpful. We were a large group of 11 and were very pleased to find ourselves upgraded to executive rooms! The hotel was very clean and nicely decorated. We stayed for two nights and the accommodation was very comfortable - in fact the bed was so big that we found ourselves quite lonely having been used to just a double!! One of our couples were awoken on the second morning by the pipes making a large banging noise. After discussion with reception who were willing to move them, they decided to stay put but enjoyed a complimentary breakfast in their room and also free drinks for all of their party for the inconvenience. Staff were very apologetic and eager to please. We choose this hotel for convenience and its locality to station and centre and we were all very pleased with our choice. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Run away !”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie L
Reviews.Content: Myself and 10 other people from my team stayed for 4 nights/ 5 days in this hotel. None of us enjoyed our stay. We travel a lot on business purpose and are very used to 4 and 5 stars hotels. This one is at the very most a 3 stars one. Hotel common areas : When arriving with your heavy suitcase you have to climb some stairs to reach the "welcome" desk. I didn't see any groom around to provide some help with luggage. The corridors are old, gloomy. During our stay only one elevator was working, you consequently had to wait for ages to get one (almost when a huge tourist group is around) . The bar is at the same time expensive with a cold ambiance and freezing because of the A/C. The service is quite long when you request for some tapas even if the bar is almost deserted. Positive point : The hotel is central located and the concierge is a real, pure jewel more than proficient. The restaurant : Food was correct, not more, even if I had to experience the most strange fish soup I ever had. The service was so long that we thought that they went to hunt the cow before serving it. And the restaurant was very far from being busy.... The breakfast, globally looks cheap, you can find several kinds of sandwich loaf but no real French bread. You cannot find a yogurt (replaced by some strange tasting curd cheese). Only 2 sorts of jam ... But at the same time we are in the Netherlands ... which are not really famous for their food. (even if you can find some very good restaurants in the city). Rooms :When I check in I was given a tiny room in the "historical wing" of the hotel.My room was looking over a "patio" consisting in 3 ugly sad walls very close to the windows. I requested to move but the "welcome" desk told me that there was not any available room better than mine (on a Sunday afternoon at 03:00pm). One of my colleagues who met the same matter (with a view on the same "patio" and it's "terrace" used as beer cases storage, was given as a replacement a tiny tiny room with a tiny single bed though I booked some queen size rooms for each of us. Rooms do not come with ironing board, you have to request for it to be delivered. The air conditioning system is locked, you cannot regulate it and of course it's very cold. The only solution is to keep it off. Positive points :The rooms are equipped with Wifi and beds are comfortable. Bathroom : No bathrobe, no slippers and the bath towels are too small to cosily wrap yourself in them. The sink stank of sewage, which was very unpleasant when you entered the room or when you had to face it when awakening. In fact I got 2 options : stay in the stench with AC off ... or ... freeze . The gym :UNBELIEVABLE !!!!!!!!!!!! You have to pay 12 euros to access the "gym" which consists in very poor equipments dispatched over 30 squared meters at the most. Explanation : The gym is not run by the hotel !!!!!!!!!!! The swimming pool is more the size of a paddling pool. I got a chance to have a look at the "modern wing" where all rooms have been refurnished. Rooms seems bigger, clean with modern convenience but there is something cold and sad emanating. Rate : 142 euros on B&B basis , but that's a corporate negotiated rate. Each of us thought it wasn't worth it. I would not recommend this hotel to anybody. Maybe convenient to non demanding huge groups of tourists but not for individual leisure or business purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: Aquaman_22
Reviews.Content: Chose to stay at the Victoria due to its super-convenient location for the central station. It is also very close to Dam Square. It really couldn't be more conveniently located. The outside of the hotel is very appealing and looks quite majestic. The lobby is okay and has a connected bar area. There always seemed to be a helpful concierge available and one night directed us to an excellent steak house a few blocks away (Toro Dorado - highly recommend). The room itself was good - not great. Clean and comfortable, not too dated. Bathrooms were also nice and clean. Only real complaints would be the hallways, which were badly in need of a face lift, and the small twin sized beds in my room. I believe we paid $140 US for one night, which I thought was very good value.

Reviews.Title: “nice and comfy. great location.”
Reviews.Author: mommy24_10
Reviews.Content: Like others have said before, it is no Hilton, but you don't expect Hilton at what we have paid. The room is very comfortable (we are three adult sisters in the room) and roomy, and clean. The breakfast is great and the staff is very nice. The location is great and there is free wi-fi (although very slow, you can upgrade if you want to pay). There is an LCD t.v with great channels, and the concierge is really at our service. All and all, we have got our money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, old corridors, very good breakfast, great location”
Reviews.Author: really_razamataz
Reviews.Content: I was in Amsterdam for business and this hotel had a group discounted rate. I've stayed in other Park Plaza's in other cities in other countries so I had no problem picking this venue. Finding the hotel from Amsterdam Central Station is easy - it is directly opposite! There is some external work going on but nothing too obtrusive. The lobby is well appointed with friendly reception staff and two concierges right there ready to assist (I need a pair of scissors during my stay and they had it with me in the twink of an eye). Once you leave the main lobby area and go to the floors, it all started to seem a bit more dated. It was a long walk to the room but the room itself was very modern and fresh, and very well kept. Good TV channel selection and certain movies seemed to have been thrown into the package to save having to walk the streets of the red light district! Outside and round the corner is Damrak, so there is plenty of restaurants and shopping nearby. Obviously the red light district is just over the road. Breakfasts were excellent with a massive choice and all very well laid out. No problem getting comfortable seating. I'd would definitely consider this for another visit to Amsterdam. Just get the corridor lighting and carpet upgraded!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: jbird4
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Park Plaza Victoria Amsterdam for 3 nights and were pleasantly surprised. As others have mentioned the hotel was "good quality", nothing lavish. The hotel is located in a great location, central downtown and a minutes walk from the Central Station. From the Central Station you can access the rest of the city via bus, tram, or train. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The room came with a queen bed, a large flat screen tv, and free internet. I think this is one of the best hotels you can get for a lower price in the downtown area. We will definitely look into booking here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing service, unreasonable prices, tired rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Vizitei
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. There are aspects of a service that a vendor can control and aspects he can't. This hotel fails on both. Location is cenral and while that can be positive, approaching this hotel for checkin by car can be daunting. Pedestrian, bike, and bus lanes separate the hotel from the road and no effort is made to meet and help arriving guests to the curb and into the hotel. Once inside, the front desk staff executes the check-in script without listening to the customer. My attempts to explain that my debit card also worked as credit did not meet with understanding. The agent warned me that they would chrgeq 75 euros in advance for incidentals, I agreed, but my later attempts to charge a meal on the room was turned down due to "lack of credit". The public areas were fine even if the furniture is a bit too warn. Hallways smelled and looked old, room was small. Bedding was find, but the bed itself dated to Reagan administration. This 4 star property has no parking of it's own nor does it have a valet services. They use an outside vendor who for 35 euros per day takes away your car for the duration of your stay. The prices at the restaurants are well beyond justification even for Amsterdam. A 30 euro modest breakfast is not reasonable. Overall, this is a barely three star hotel pretending to be 4. Find Another option.

Reviews.Title: “Eh Rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kcarta
Reviews.Content: Rooms weren't overly impressive, but super convenient to the train station and the "main drag."

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for your Amsterdam stay - so close to central train station”
Reviews.Author: Patrick W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel SEPT 2011 - and what a great location. Right across canal ( very short walk) to the hotel from the central train station. Great help at front desk - great help from the conceriege, and just a few blocks from ALL the sites to see in Amsterdam We walked everywhere from hotel. We upgraded to URBAN room - way cool - very modern and clean with LCD TV and ultra modern bathroom fixtures. NO CHARGE - for internet - although it was less then 1mb in speed - but no charge, so cant complain - especially for Europe.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: wastewar
Reviews.Content: Super hotel. Amazing staff who were so helpful getting tickets, assisting with reservations and offering a can-do attitude for everything. Small, clean, quiet rooms. Fantastic hotel location!! Delish lounge with great views of the action outside; enjoyable restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing & Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Katzen2008
Reviews.Content: For 250 euros, we expected a lot more. The building is currently buried in scaffolding (our "view" to Centraal Station was shrouded by a several-stories high silk screen-type advertisement). The lobby is bright and spacious, leading one to (erroneously) assume that the rest of the hotel's quality will be comparable. We were put into the older part of the hotel. Incredibly musty and dingy common areas on all of the floors. Dirty, dated brown carpets which were full of burns and stains, decrepit cleaning equipment left in the halls, dirty windows. The room itself ("Executive") was better - still musty, but less so. It would have been fine with a tiled or wood floor (or clean carpet). Coffee maker didn't work. Only 1 of the elevators worked - people were waiting 10 minutes or more. Service at the desk was abysmally slow (not enough staff). Disappointing all around - wouldn't go back nor recommend ....

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not the nicest part of town”
Reviews.Author: martingerardkelly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated close to Central Station, on the corner of Damrak, near Dam Square. I was in Amsterdam for a conference, and the hotel was booked for me. Otherwise, I wouldn't have chosen it. It is rated as a 4 star - I just don't think it deserves that. For starters, though it was nice & tidy etc., it really is not that impressive. The outside is all covered in scaffolding, and not much to look at. On the inside, really not '4 star' impressive. Probably warrants a 'good 3 star'. The room was tidy, clean but incredibly dark, with the walls painted black. Bed nice & comfy, bathroom well appointed. Breakfast was good, & good selection. Streets in immediate vicinity a bit dingy. There is an awful lot of work going on in this part of town, so not nice to look at. The restaurant/brasserie had a poor selection & was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean. Surprisingly Quiet for A'dam”
Reviews.Author: BigAl_naAlba
Reviews.Content: I would definitely visit here again. I stayed here in Spring 2011 it was restful, clean and compared to anywhere else I have stayed in A'dam, quiet, although I did explicitly ask for a room at the back of the hotel. I liked the ease of access to the airport via the train station just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “No mice spotted”
Reviews.Author: flowerofscotland10
Reviews.Content: This hotel has had some rather extraordinary reviews just recently (see e.g. the â€œseniledelâ€� review of 16 August), and so letâ€™s say straight away that we spotted no vermin of any kind! Our room was in the old part of the hotel, and while it is true that some of the old staircases emit a somewhat musky smell, the room itself was very modern, attractively furnished, reasonably spacious for a superior double, and generally very comfortable, with excellent in-room facilities such as a keyboard in the room giving access to the Internet via a large flat screen TV. The check-in process was efficient and quick and the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Check-out was equally speedy. The hotel is ideally located right opposite Amsterdam Centraal railway station, and most of the main tourist attractions are easily within walking distance. However, while one would expect to pay a premium rate for such a central location in a major European city, the rate for a superior double, GBP 350 for the night (booked via lastminute.com, payable in full in advance, and non-refundable/non-cancellable), still strikes me as quite extortionate.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, if a little bland”
Reviews.Author: snowman40
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris one week and Amsterdam the next. The common element was that both cities were busy and I ended up in better than usual hotels on business trips. The outside of the Crown Plaza Victoria looks a bit old and fusty, but inside it's bright and well appointed. My room was a double on the second floor with a 'view' into the central void, but it was roomy and the bed very comfortable. The decor in the room was a little bland and dark and the corridors felt like those soul-less American hotels where every floor and corridor looks exactly the same. As a slightly grudging traveller it was quite nice to find BBC1 on the TV and lots of hot water in the shower (albeit not exactly HIGH pressure). Location wise, right opposite the main station, the hotel is excellent as it's only a few yards stroll into the Red Light district, canals and the main part of town. The hotel's advertised sports centre was a bit disappointed as the pool was tiny and everything else had to be paid for (Â£10 for a sauna, etc). Breakfast was an excellent buffet with plenty of choice in a bright restaurant. I'd happily stay at the PP Victoria any day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - everything else mediocre”
Reviews.Author: divapp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during a business trip and although the location is excellent there is very little else to truly redeem this hotel. The concierge desk was hardly ever manned, you usually had to wait a long while before somebody bothered showing up. They were very helpful when they did show up though. The rooms had a vague musty feel to them and the beds were not comfortable despite the fact that we stayed in the "urban" section of the hotel. Cleanliness was a problem though,the carpets in the rooms were dated. That being said, the internet connection was decent and the breakfast spread in the morning was good. Personally I wouldn't recommend this hotel, but if location is all you really care about, this hotel is close to pretty much everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Really central, good rooms and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: lpagross
Reviews.Content: The Park Plaza Victoria couldn't be more centrally located, really convenient. Of course the trade-off with such a fantastically central location is a bit of noise from the streets, traffic, pedestrian crossings and trams. If you're going to be spending your nights out until late you'll probably be fine as it quietens down around 4am. I don't think the hotel could do much to change this as it's all down to the location. We were on the first floor facing the street so used ear plugs and that worked fine. The room was nice and well specified (although the corridors look really tired). Wi fi worked fine and the TV had a great picture (although we didn't watch it much) and good choice of channels. I didn't try the spa but the desk staff were really friendly and helpful. There's some work taking place on the outside of the hotel but it didn't seem to cause any disturbance. Would recommend it and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dated Hotel, even the new wing.”
Reviews.Author: joesmoe00
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very old, and they haven't done a very good job of restoring it. That being said the location is absolutely excellent. The TV's are old CRTs, with few english options. The beds are old, and have a kind of muggy feeling to them. The food at the hotel is acceptable but nothing to brag about. The service is okay, but again nothing to write home about. I didn't use the internet, so i'm not sure if they have it or not. The rooms are a good size though.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel rooms in modern wing, poor restaurant”
Reviews.Author: DavidCAnnahilt
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel as it was near central station and the start of the Dam to Dam running race. The booking request for a room in the new part of the Hotel was ignored, and we were shown to a room with one single bed for two of us! This mistake was quickly rectified and we asked and got an upgraded room which was excellent. We wanted a quiet meal before the race the next day so we went to the retaurant at about 7 and requested a table. We were pointed to a table, and then told were were at the wrong one! We waited 15 minutes to be offered a drink then 30 minutes between each courses. The glasses were lined up at the side of our table and no-one offered us more drink or took the empties away. Food was OK but pretty expensive. The Retaurant manager was dealing with one table of four who wouldn't pay the bill because the sevice was so bad, another table then started to complain and the restaurant manager seemed to just leave. The younger staff were very pleasant, but obviously not managed well. When you spend â‚¬400 + for two nights Bed, one breakfast and one dinner you need to be treated better than this. Only filed the trip advisor review after a poor response from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but shabby, not all it could be”
Reviews.Author: RogueRogan
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed on arrival to find that there was a stag or similar party being rather loud in the bar - didn't really create the right impression as soon as we walked in. At that moment I began to doubt the hotel was truly a 4* hotel, given the price that I'd just paid in advance for the hotel it was quite disheartening - keeping in mind that this was the most I've ever paid for a hotel that didn't include even breakfast. Me and my partner just exchanged glances - but we both wondered what type of hotel it was and whether we'd been "ripped off". I didn't find the check-in experience particularly impressive, didn't get anything mentioned about the loyalty scheme or even breakfast. It could have possibly been the noise coming from the bar, but not particularly an excuse. We had a room that was on the first floor, I was rather worried about noise so asked upon arrival but was told that there were no other rooms available. Thankfully it was relatively quiet, however it was one of the darkest most depressing rooms I've been in even with all the lights on. The bed was not great and the interior furnishings and carpet in the room looked quite old and due for renewal. Bathroom was in a similar condition. The heating and the airconditioning had both been left on. I've been in budget hotels that were better. The teas and coffees in the room had not been stocked up on our arrival and even after the room had been cleaned the following morning, we didn't get any replenishment - so we had to telephone housekeeping. To be fair to them, they were very quick to remedy this issue. However, I've again been in budget hotels where this hasn't happened. Another point of the room was the fact that there was an extortionately priced bottle of water in the room, I've stayed in many hotels across the world and it's rare that water is a chargeable item and is usually provided complimentary. Especially true of 4* hotels. Also we found that there was only one extra pillow in the wardrobe, which had no pillow case upon it. Again we telephoned for housekeeping and they speedily remedied the problem bring two pillows. Again I'm thinking of a few popular budget hotel chains that this hasn't happened in too. I found it disappointing that after bringing my shorts and gym clothes from the UK that the gym in the hotel was an extra charge too. Aside from the cosmetics and the general decor of the room that obviously need updating. There is obviously an issue with consistency and there should be at the very least check-sheets for the cleaning staff upon both regular cleaning and changeover before the room is marked as complete or ready for the next tenant. Upon leaving the hotel which was around 12 noon on the Monday, there was a large queue at reception - given that 12 is check-out time, I would expect more staff than the single member to be on duty. The process was slow, the member of staff was obviously overwhelmed and there was a queue that included ourselves who were all understandably irritated, especially as there were a large number of concierge staff not doing anything other than talking! We were waiting to be asked how our stay was, in order to address some of these matters but simply weren't asked. Averaging over Â£200 per night, this is as I said one of the most expensive hotels I've ever stayed in - I certainly don't feel given the issues above that I got value for money, the standards that the hotel set are nowhere near good enough to justify the cost. I'd be unlikely to recommend the hotel and indeed would actively discourage anyone visiting Amsterdam from staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Trip”
Reviews.Author: Queen K
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 8/30 to 9/6/2011. When I come back will stay here again. Location is the best, right at Central Station where you can get a train, bus, canal boat, or tram to everything. My room was great. I stayed in the Urban Wing. The staff was all you could ask for, very very, helpful. I am a single woman over 60 traveling alone and would recommend this hotel for anyone who travels alone. I stayed out late eveynite, having tea and "nitecap" at the local coffeehouses and had no fears about walking back to my hotel. Stay here, send an email ahead and ask for a room in the Urban Wing.

Reviews.Title: “Have Given Up”
Reviews.Author: europeeveryyear
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times in the past. It got worse every time. Front Desk staff are rude, the rooms are not ready on time, the Hotel Management does not respond to feedback accompanied by pictures that show the dirt and the wear and tear of rooms they reguard as upgraded. This Hotel is an embarrassment to the Park Plaza reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Central location.”
Reviews.Author: Jonisaoer
Reviews.Content: I choise this hotel because it was directly across from Central Train Station and Museum Boat Dock and a short walk from Dam Square. We were able walk everywhere in the city. Large room for European standards and very nice, the service was outstanding. The breakfast buffet was not worth the price but make sure included in room rate. Only complaint was be comfort, it was way too soft

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Night's Sleep”
Reviews.Author: Romablade
Reviews.Content: A stone's throw from Central Station. A nice hotel that has recently been updated. Like most renovated Park Plaza's the beds are comfortable, the rooms are neat and tidy and the shower is big and powerful. Essential criteria for a good night's sleep. The room has a selection of good, usable toiletries so you don't need to worry about taking liquids through the airport if you're only carrying hand luggage. The hotel is walking distance from most of Amsterdam's main sights and the Dutch tram and railway system means taking a train to the office, wherever in Amsterdam it is, is painless (and much cheaper than a taxi and often quicker due to traffic). I had a tasty simple meal of mussels and frites in the Brasserie and it was reasonably priced for hotel food (EUR19.50). I've stayed here before when, I think, it was a Tulip Hotel and then later a NH Hotel and the Carlsson Group have improved on what was already good. A little pricey though if you choose to go when there's an exhibition or similar on in Amsterdam, even though the hotel was far from full. I think they must block reserve rooms, so might be worth booking late... You can ask for a quiet room or room with a view (the view being of the plaza in front of Central Station). I took the view as the rooms have been recently renovated and I like to watch the city in action, but be warned you will be woken by clunking trams early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great location!”
Reviews.Author: SBhattacharyya
Reviews.Content: Right opposite the majestic Victoria station. You can actually take the Schiphol Express from the airport straight to the hotel. Just that the hotel signage is not too visible, you might walk past the front door and not notice. So, it's better to ask someone. The hotel's location is great - you can walk to the boat stops right in front and take a canal cruise to the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum etc. The red light district is a short walk from the hotel past the National Monument. Just be a bit careful late at night, you might find some drug pushers around that area, but that's normal I guess, a firm no does the trick. The rooms are excellent here, great view and spacious which is refreshing in Europe! The staff is helpful and prompt. Overall, a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business and for leisure”
Reviews.Author: HJCLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in THE best location for the main sights of Amsterdam, right opposite Centraal Station, so everything is accessible and easy. My room was very clean and comfortable, but the best thing about the experience was the unfailingly helpful and friendly staff. Look out for Ursula at breakfast - she is a service legend - and the wonderful concierge team (Peter) will cheerfully answer any question about the city, give advice and help to make the most of your stay. If you stay there, then engage with the staff as they really seem to want to help and take pleasure in doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Horizonslb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just across the street from the beautful train station in amsterdam. You can walk to all the downtown stores, coffee houses and even the red ligth district. I am not a walker and it was perfect. you can catch the two story bus and ride through the further locations, i.e. the beautful Rijk's Museum...we read reviews on the hotel and many said to make sure we ask for the Urban wing. They were filled in that wing but our reasonably priced room was clean and beautful! So do not worry about nit getting the urban wing. Do not accept room 117 or 118 on the second floor because you need to walk a long long hall and then go back down 2 flights. The red light district was not sleazy at all, the streets were very charming and the red windows just had girks in bikinis winking. Loved the town, loved the relaxed energy there. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: chichi81
Reviews.Content: We took a train from Paris to Amsterdam on the 5 Sep. Upon arriving at Central Station we were thrilled to find that our hotel was literally across the road. We made our way to the hotel and first impressions were nice lobby area, very busy ...looks very modern in the cocktail lounge. There was a huge line at check in but the staff were very attentative and quick so we were proabably only waiting for about 10 mins max. "The Good" - Location and staff are what makes this hotel. Very close the red light district, cafes, shopping malls and attractions. The staff make you feel comfortable and are very welcoming. The bed in our room was big and comfy. There is a Nespresso machine in our room for all the coffee lovers it's a bonus. Room service food was yummy but not much choice on the menu. Buffet Breakfast on the other hand was great with heaps of choices of food. Wi fi is free but high speed is extra you have to pay an hourly or daily rate. "The Bad" - We pre paid our Executive Room through Expedia at just under $300AUD a night I was shocked when I got to the room 212. To get to our room you have to go through another set of doors and it's in the staircase area. (strange as I thought executive was meant to be nicer than the average rooms?) We had to turn the airconditioning off in the room as it was extremely loud, the sound resembles a plane about to take off. There is construction going on right outside our window so there is non stop banging going on. Perhaps the hotel should not provide these rooms while construction is going on or at least advise us of this.No Bathrobes or slippers (4 star hotel?) towels were tiny I'm 5 foot 2 and it was small for my liking. My fiance is 6 foot 1 and could barely wrap himself up in the towels. "The Ugly" - The smell coming from the staircase right outside our room. Our view of the construction that was going on. My partner and I were celebrating our engagement so I didn't want to complain much as I knew it would just ruin our trip. We off to Monte Carlo tomorrow so fingers crossed our hotel there is much better. To sum it up location and staff are good but would I stay here again for the price we paid? Probably not. Also I think this hotel has a new section and an old section unfortunately for us we got put in the old section and to top it off our room was outside in the staircase of the old section! I love Amsterdam :)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant!!!”
Reviews.Author: varun b
Reviews.Content: Arrived and were met by smiling and courteous reception staff. Were upgraded from superior room to the Queen Anne suite in the Urban wing. Room was clean with huge bed and the softest cloud-like pillows. The coffee machine was a little problematic but the always helpful and efficient staff happily provided a kettle. The view overlooked an alleyway and faced another building but it was quiet and we didn't spend too much time in the room. The hotel is in the best possible location so close to Centraal station and walking distance to Dam square and most attractions. Only 18min train journey from Schiphol airport and the splendour of the hotel as you leave the station is reassuring and impressive. The entrance and the lobby area are plush and almost serene. The biggest plus apart from the location and the standard of the environment is without doubt....the STAFF. Everybody I dealt with on reception and the concierge desk were polite, friendly and professional. Will definitely stay here again and strongly recommending to my friends and family. Thank you for exceeding our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great breakfast - would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Bojangles104
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our one year anniversary, upon arrival at reception we were also upgraded by the receptionist to one of the newly refurbished Urban wing rooms, which was great. The beds were so comfortable and it was one mattress rather than the usual two pushed together, we slet very well. Our view was over looking the Central Station, but as we were on the top floor we had no problems with noise. The air conditioning worked which was just aswell as it was 26 degrees during our stay, and it's good that you can alter it yourself. Breakfast was included in our rate and it was great, good choice - especially the cappucino and tea - hot not luke warm like I have experienced in other hotels. Location fantastic, would definitely stay here again and recommend to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, showing it's age.”
Reviews.Author: Abster_travels
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights in anexecutive room (no 125) which had a great layout (mezzanine) but had no outlook (both windows looked over the roof directly into someone elses room!) the room was spacious, clean and comfortable, yet furnished in dark wood, which made the room very dark. AC didn't work so we nearly boiled in our skins! Thing is, in AMS you are hardly in your room, so as long as it's comfortable for sleeping-no worries. We stayed using reward points so didn't pay- if we had paid, we would have asked to move rooms. Service and position of the hotel both great. Extortionate breakfast prices- 18euro each- we found a Devine holland bakery in the lanes behind the hotel with beautiful artisan breads and Dutch cheeses which was a fraction of the cost. Worst of all- the hotel charged us 50c to use the toilet in the reception!! Even if you are a guest! Ripoff. Overall, we would stay again because of the location (right in the middle of the action opposite central station) but would avoid paying full price!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HiBe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a group of friends for an oval week-end. The location is simply perfect for exploring Amsterdam. Hotel is nice and airy with a lovely bar-area. The hotel was buzzing while we were there, staff was still smiling, attentive and service-minded. We celebrated a birthday and different requests were met with a no-problem attitude. We had a nice traditionally decorated room, which was spacious and towards the atrium. Very quiet! Some of us got the newly refurbished modern rooms, and were equally pleased with those. Big, proper double bed (not the two annoying mattresses sliding apart during the night as many other hotels have.) slept like a log! Spacious and airy breakfast room with a good, all-you-need breakfast. Good cheeses, fresh fruit and good coffee. Simply a very nice week end in a very nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK room, great breakfast, but overall not hugely impressive”
Reviews.Author: Babelfish84
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night during the week as a result of a work trip. This was booked through a subsidiary of Expedia. I was booked in for a Bed & Breakfast in the Superior category. Arrived and all was well, I requested a room with a bath a opposed to just a shower and was given a room on the 2nd floor. Only downside is that they charge you a deposit of â‚¬75 for extra charges. You can pay this on credit card, but if you only have a debit card, there are costs involved in getting it put back on the card, so I ended up having to pay cash. I also think â‚¬75 deposit for extra charges for 1 night is a bit extreme.... The room itself was a bit meh. I mean, it was nice enough, but really nothing to write home about, some of the furniture looked a little tired and the bed seemed a little tired too, not an evenly shaped mattress. The bathroom was nice, apart from the absolutely horrendous bright white light. I know a bathroom needs decent lighting, but this was seriously OTT and worse than in the worst kind of shop changing rooms, it was industrial light and just offputting. Aircon was great as you can control it yourself. The view was non-existent, other rooms were having a window looking out at only a couple of meters away, meaning curtains have to be closed at all times, making it feel stuffy. The lobby itself is beautiful. Breakfast was great - Dutch breakfast buffets are 10x better than English as they cater for a variety, the fresh fruit & yoghurt were excellent as were the pastries and pancakes. Decent selection of hot drinks too. I then proceeded to check out and was asked whether I had used breakfast. I responded yes as I had a Bed & Breakfast. The lady then told me that breakfast was not included in my room rate! Luckily I had my calendar confirmation which very clearly stated Bed & Breakfast, but it left a bad taste that I felt I had to prove what I had booked or else risk forking out a hefty amount for breakfast - it's not my fault if their booking differs from what I have been given, and they told me 90% of Expedia bookings was room only. Well - I have no idea about that, I can only go by my booking which definitely included breakfast. I would return to the hotel as the location is just too convenient to ignore, but based on my experience I doubt I would really recommend it to tourists as such.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Very Central”
Reviews.Author: Bucks_Martin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in August and was pleased and impressed. Our room was in the Urban Wing, which Iâ€™m led to believe is more modern, it was spacious, comfortable and clean. Room was cleaned each day and did an excellent job tidying up. The bathroom had a fantastic shower as well. Special mention of the concierge service, we used it a couple of times. Always very helpful and knowledgeable â€“ Recommended a good Dutch restaurant one evening and booked a table at the Hard Rock Cafe on one of the other evenings. Helped with which tram to catch and looked after our luggage on our final day. If you do need help â€“ Do ask! As all other reviews say, this hotel is incredibly central and convenient for most attractions in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “great loaction, hotel a little tired”
Reviews.Author: SusanWellington
Reviews.Content: ok. It's 120 yrs old but could use a bit of a facelift. The location is excellent. Right opposite the train station and in the centre of everything. The first room I was given had no drawers, a tiny shower and bathroom area, a window that didn't open and the air con was not working. It was after midnight and I had just arrived. I called to request a change of room since this was too small for my 6 day stay and also the lack of working air con was not ok. Although the hotel was pretty full, the front desk people were extremely accomodating and changed my room to one that was bigger, had a functioning window, a bath and working air con. Thanks to those guys for helping out. The lobby area is quite nice but the hallways and the rooms are a bit tired. The carpet especially has seen better days. I thought the price was high but the response when I say this is " this is Amsterdam". The breakfast is good if you stick to the cereal, fruit, cheese etc. The eggs looked strange...all in one big piece. Not at all appetizing. The pancakes were nice as were the variety of breads. There are many places just oustide for brekky if it's not included in the room price. TV is large and lots of English channels. Was able to watch the US open. Free internet in your room was a bonus and also down in the lobby where there is a printer also available. Concierge a great resource for places to go etc.

Reviews.Title: “Some rooms better than others”
Reviews.Author: Dimm_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I most recently stayed in this hotel in June, The quality of room differs vastly, I think thereâ€™s a rolling refurbishment and some rooms are really nice while others are a bit old. My room had been newly decorated and it felt calm and relaxing. A large shower and very clean bathroom went with the comfortable bed. It was a bit hard to find the room as it was up and down different way to get to it. The Hotel is very busy so sometimes a queue at reception but the staff are more than helpful. The Central Station is on the other side of the square so itâ€™s easy to get to from the Airport on a â‚¬3.70 ticket. The attractions are mainly from the Station down Damrak so the Hotel is well placed. A good restaurant on the ground floor is used for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Modern....hmmm not my experience”
Reviews.Author: SaraGarza719
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Amsterdam with my parents... We checked in this hotel and went to our rooms. My husband's and my room looked like a Best Western from the 90's....yet my parent room was amazing! So beautiful and modern. Make sure to request a new room.

Reviews.Title: “Busy but efficient”
Reviews.Author: British_Batman
Reviews.Content: The newly renovated wing, over the bridge, has the better rooms although there are some bizarrely shaped ones in the old wing which are entertainingly novel. The facilities all work well, nice flat-screen TV, good showers and plenty of space for the businessman to work if necessary. The lighting in the bathrooms could be improved and number of TV channels widened but otherwise this place works well. The location is ideal and the staff are very helpful across the board from Reception, to the Concierge, Room Service and the Breakfast team. I don't work at the hotel, just stay a lot through business and have no complaints (apart from tram and tourist noise outside which cannot be prevented given its location).

Reviews.Title: “A hotel of two halves - and disappointing given the reviews”
Reviews.Author: MikeyPalmerE3
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms via a last minute website. I did ask to be fair for a nice view for my mum which they did at checkin without prompting. Her room was fine, clean and well appointed. However, all the good feelings disappeared when having taken 5 mins to find my room it was down a narrow spiral staircase on a mezzanine floor. A narrow room with only half a wardrobe. The effect being the tea and coffee are on the floor or the wardrobe and the mini safe above head height. The worst part of this "superior" room is the bathroom where the bath takes up half the space. To reach the bath and basin you have to turn sideways to squeeze past the toilet.The pluses of free wifi and the location are outweighed for me by the room which for a"superior" room it's disappointing, poor and NOT value for money. To avoid the same fate - it's room 115

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired and even stinky...”
Reviews.Author: Sibvaleo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very tired and old-fashioned, though it looks great from the outside. The lobby is tiny and very inconvenient if you have big bags. The corrodors are crampy and dark with stinking old carpets. Our room was of executive category, but the only thing that was good - was a Nespresso coffe machine. The rest is so tired, old, cheap and neglected! The bathroom was as tiny as simple (if not to say cheap). Breakfast is mediocre - nothing to eat at all, and the dining hall is so cold, gloomy and forlorn. I will never stay here (if I visit Amsterdam once again, what is quite hard to imagine - it's not a city to return in).

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Lancellot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok. Note it is walking distance from the station and red light district.

Reviews.Title: “'Meh' - standard hotel, nothing exciting”
Reviews.Author: BurnleyStudent
Reviews.Content: At check in we'd just walked through pouring down rain and the check in assistant was quite rude about needing our passport. Not a great first impression. Apart from that basically what we expected, standard hotel in a fantastic location. Can't emphasise how well placed it is! Taxi rank right outside and surrounded by places to eat, we ended up heading quite far south into the city for dinner to get out of the generic tourist trap a little bit. Should add we called down for an ironing board which arrived within 5 minutes or so which was impressive so pulls up the overall service a bit. Overall not a bad hotel for a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you like mice!”
Reviews.Author: seniledelinquent78
Reviews.Content: I've used the Victoria since the 1970's. When I stayed there last there were mice running around my bedroom. I have not been back for a while but last month I decided to try it again. I wish I hadn't. OK, the bedroom was mouse free. In the bar near reception there were 2 mice running around picking up bits of food that had been dropped on the floor. They were not concerned about the customers in the bar so I can only assume that they had been there a time. The hotel manager, Jan Willem Roenhorst was apologetic when I complained about mice running around in an area that serves food but by his attitude it was obvious that he was aware of the problem. This is a huge shame, the hotel has always been one of my favourites, it is well situated for the city and public transport and the staff are excellent. My advice, if you decide to stay there take your own cat. Alternatively, if you want to share your stay in Amsterdam with animals running around you then consider sleeping at Artis Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing staff and comfertable rooms”
Reviews.Author: OEitan
Reviews.Content: we spent 5 nights at the Victoria Hotel earlier this month (august 2011) and we enjoyed our stay very much. The staff was very helpful and advised us daily about different attractions in Amsterdam. They provided us with several discounts and no line tickets which saved us both money and time. The Rooms (at the new wing) were spacious, comfertable and we had a nice view (pic attached) of the central station area from our 7th floor rooms (no noise inside the rooms). The free wifi service was at a speed that was enough to make audio calls via viber. Anyway, we did not have to upgrade it to the high speed internet. Breakfast was a delight every morning. We could not skip it even on the morning we left (06:30 AM).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: KatNYC1
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night, but the experience was perfect in every way. The room was bigger than most European hotel rooms we had stayed in and it really was beautiful- very modern. The shower, the AC, the flatscreen wall TV all worked great, the bed was super comfy, the room was very clean. We didn't have a chance to eat here because we went out exploring, so I can't comment on the food, but it did look a little expensive. The canal tour boat stops right by the hotel. The staff made us feel instantly welcome (friendly, smiling) and they held our bags until the room was ready. The receptionist and the concierge seemed to go out of their way to make sure our needs were met, and that our questions were answered. Very nice manager. They have a pool. We were there on vacation and had picked the hotel mainly because it was right across the street from the train station and we needed to be at the airport by 6:30 AM the next morning. We were pleasantly surprised at how gracious everyone was to us, because we are young students (20 and 21), and the hotel seemed (from the website) more geared to business clientele. We had also gotten a super cheap room rate by booking early on their website, so we figured we would get a less than average room. But they treated us very well and gave us a great room in the Urban wing. You can walk to most of the sights from this hotel, some museums and souvenir shops are right around the corner on Dam street which leads up to Dam square. We felt very safe in the area and the hotel is very secure and well managed. I want to mention here that the train to the airport is easy to take. The first one leaves about 5 AM and we walked right across the street from the Victoria Hotel (so convenient) to the train station, purchased a ticket from the counter person, ( 4.30 Euro) who directed us upstairs (there's an elevator or escalator) to the train- it's all very safe, well lit, and the train was fast, about 15 minutes and youre inside the airport terminal!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel, the staff, and the location!”
Reviews.Author: jhs820
Reviews.Content: We just spent the week at the Park Plaza Victoria Amsterdam. The hotel has a convenient location for traveling and for sight seeing in the city center. The hotel is beautiful and has a grand entrance and lobby. The restaurant was one of the best in Amsterdam, and the breakfast buffet was amazing! Our rooms were a good size, clean, pretty, quiet. The staff was exceptionally friendly, hospitable, and professional. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Extreamly pleased”
Reviews.Author: jhe75
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel experience me and my wife ever had. The hotel itself is a beautiful building located in the beginning of Damrak, so it is very close to everything. When we arrived, the friendly guy at the front desk told us that they had upgraded our room to a business suite for free...and the room was really really great :) We stayed for 6 nights and we're so impressed by the hotel itself, but even more impressed by the staff. The staff is genuinely friendly and service minded - all of them. I suspect that the hotel is careful when they hire new people:) We will for sure come back!

Reviews.Title: “NOT GOING BACK”
Reviews.Author: alphonse82
Reviews.Content: Great location, service, and rooms The only downside, which is BIG was that the hotel was infested with rats I discovered one in my room and saw several in the foyer resutarant/bar I undertand that rodents can be a problem in any inner city, howover, the hotel seemed overrun with them It was nice of front desk to updgrade my room once I reported, however I will not be returning

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: CK2009
Reviews.Content: After arriving early afternoon at Schiphol Airport, we took the first train into Amsterdam Central Station. Exiting the station, it was great to see the Park Plaza Victoria just across the canal. Check-in took a while, but the room, overlooking the canal and the train station, was very nice. Quiet, nice beds (including the roll-away bed that our daughter used). They upgraded us to a slightly larger room to accomodate the roll-away; though the room was still a bit tight. Clearly recently remodeled. Its location, especially for a one-night stay, was ideal especially if traveling by train. We walked over the the Anne Frank House in about 20 minites; 10 minutes to Dam Square; 10 minutes to the Olde Church. And basically one block to a half-dozen tram lines. If you can find a good rate (we booked via Expedia), its definitely worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: demidov48
Reviews.Content: Great Location Good breakfast Good rooms BAD: Charge me extra 65 EUR after leaving. I don't understand what for.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - lovely staff and good rooms”
Reviews.Author: neds0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night only in June 2011. On check in we were upgraded to a suite, which was quite a luxury after being in a smaller cabin on a river cruise. The lady that checked us in was so helpful and polite. We made our way up to our suite and quickly got settled As the hotel is in the main street we found waling around Amsterdam very easy. We walked to the Anne Frank House, Dam square and could walk to the red light district although we had seen it before. The hotel has a lovely bar and as we were not very hungry, chose to order bar food and drinks. We had some plates to share but the croquettes were so good we ordered another plate. It was so relaxed sitting watching out the window on huge arm chairs. Our rooms were very comfortable, so clean and had everything we could want. We had a buffet breakfast in the main dining room and although there were a few problems will refilling of items, we did pass the feedback on and already this is being looked at. This hotel is right across from Central Station. Also a short walk from where the River Cruises dock. I highly recommend a stay at the Park Plaza Victoria and do hope we get back there again too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, spacious rooms, fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: Monicuba23
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Park Plaza Victoria Amsterdam for one night during our European vacation. The location is just across the canal from the train station, which makes traveling by rail much easier. The train to/from the airport is also located just across the canal. The rooms are very spacious and an excellent value, if you are able to obtain a discounted rate. The concierge was very helpful, with tickets to various attractions available for purchase, thereby avoiding the long lines at the various museums and events. I've stayed at numerous hotels in Amsterdam, including the Renaissance and the Hilton. The Park Plaza certainly provides good value and is on par with the others.

Reviews.Title: “Wow ....... Dream come True !”
Reviews.Author: goldielock08
Reviews.Content: Where do i start from right from Entering the hotel to Leaving it was 5* service !! when we entered the staff were all friendly, we got our room at once only to discover we entered some else room ( which was good for us - I Guess), upgraded at once .... and it was Heaven ! The view was Fab Central Station just opp and we could see the Canals, trams, people all around but not a drop of noise could be heard in our rooms. Breakfast was good and Dennis at the concierge was soooo helpful and just great ! Thanks and keep up the good work .

Reviews.Title: “Historic class with modern touch”
Reviews.Author: hoff711
Reviews.Content: From the moment we exited the cab from out river boat we were greeted with helpful and energetic staff. The front desk and the concierge were quick to assist us in checking in and holding our luggage until the room was ready. The location of the hotel was exception, right across from the train station. The chandeliers, pool, and rooms sparkled with cleanliness. Breakfast was plentiful and delicious. The on site restaurant was exceptional in taste, service and variety (we chose to eat there for more than 2 meals)

Reviews.Title: “Central location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: StevieLip
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed here in march 2010. Its located across the bridge from the train station. Great for those arriving by the train from the airport. The hotel was very clean and welcoming. We did notavail of any services but the room was very clean and comfortable. Would recommend this hotel to anyone as its location is s great base for exploring Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: higgins68
Reviews.Content: i love this hotel, it looks so grand and is just across the road from the train station. We usually stop here when we can get a good deal, otherwise it is expensive. The rooms are good but many don't have windows, but hey you are in amsterdam who spends time in their room. Lovely complimentary wash products, clean rooms and really comfortable beds. Just cross over the main road and you are in the red light district, which we love. we have stopped at this hotel 4 times now and it will always be my first choice when coming to amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: dimapsi
Reviews.Content: Located at just 130 mts from the Amsterdam Centraal Station (train and trams), less than 50 to the canal boats and just over the Damrak avenue, it was a very good place to stay while visiting Amsterdam. Very clean, and good service. Buffet breakfast was a little to expensive (20â‚¬ per person), so we choose to have breakfast in many of the near located places. Hotel has a pool for use for the guests and free wifi. Would stay there again. Rooms are very modern. We had a superior room with LCD, minibar, complimentary coffee and tea. The room was on the urban wing with a window to a small alley. It was very quiet with the windows closed. Once you open them, depending on the hour you may hear some noise, but was not a problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and well located.”
Reviews.Author: delaplanche
Reviews.Content: In front and at 150 meters of Central Station, it was a natural choice for us stay in Victoria arriving by train with large family and luggage. Short walking distance. King and gentle people at front desk and conciergerie. Modern look bedrooms, clean bathrooms, good quality products in breakfast. Forgot the keychain in the safe but they found it and quickly sent it to me. Got no problems staying there, walking distance to almost all monuments and museums in the city. I just thought a little overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and excellent location in most respects”
Reviews.Author: stevehutch
Reviews.Content: Well apponted hotel in centre of Amsterdam walking distance of Central Station, city centre, red light district etc. We very much enjoyed our 3 night stay although the weather had a part to play. Our room was an executive on the front of the hotel which gives a great view towards the stately station frontage 400 metres away. Unfortunately room 311 had an air conditioning system which sounded like a jet engine so we turned it off throughout our stay - which would have been a problem ( for the hotel at least) in hotter weather conditions. A pity the gym was not included in the free leisure facilities and that breakfast was not included and cost 23 Euros extra. With the wealth of cafes and restaurants eating out was the least of our concerns. Very comfortable king size bed, bathroom good and a large room - a bit pricey at Â£200 a night once taxes were added on but the very good location balanced this out. Free wireless throughout hotel but pretty slow. Staff all friendly and no issues - a special mention to all the concierge's especially Tim who kept us well looked after. Amsterdam is expensive (like all of Euroland) and the hotel was no exception. All in all we would certainly stay there again should we return.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, poor deco, nice restaurant”
Reviews.Author: mariaspain
Reviews.Content: We visited Amsterdam in June 2011 for 4 days. I needed to attend a conference during 2 of the days in the RAI conference centre, so we needed to be as close to the Tram as possible but we also wanted to be close to the city centre for sightseeing. We decided to stay near Centraal station, which suited us for the trip, buut if we ever come back to Amsterdam we'd rather stay in a different area such as Museumplein or the Jordan!!! You see the hotel directly opposite the station once you walk out of it. We found very difficult to choose a hotel for our break as we found them all very expensive with poor review. At the time I was 5.5 months pregnant, so I needed a decent rest!! I emailed the hotel twice on advance (and a reminder a few days earlier) telling them that we would be arriving early in the morning and that I was pregnant, so we would really appreciate if they had a quiet room ready. As every other hotel, they said they would try. However, they didnt have any room for us on arrival. Firstly they said to come back at midday, then at 1, then at 2. Eventually they gave us a tiny noisy room!! We complaint and 2 hours later we changed into a nice large enough quiet room. At that point we were seriously exhausted and angry! The room was comfortable, decently clean and in serious need of a revamp, but it was good enough. The bathroom was tiny, but it had a nice shower/bath. We found quite hard to find somewhere decent and not overprice to eat in the area. we ended up having dinner twice in the hotel and they were by far the best meals we had during out break. They have a 3 course set menu for around 30 euros per person. There is a cute bakery in an alleyway behind the hotel where you can buy a cake, coffee, pancake for breakfast and a small shop in the main street (3 min walk from hotel) where you can buy water, crisps, buiscuits, soaps and other essentials. We did not wan to pay 22 euros for the buffet breakfast but we discovered on our last day that they have other breakfast options that are very nice and just enough amount for 10 euros. If only we had discovered it sooner! The staff in the restaurant was also nice and helpful. Overall the hotel did the job locationwise and we did not have any other complaints (except the problems on arrival). Should we ever need to be near Centraal again, we will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but not the best”
Reviews.Author: JudithChalmers09
Reviews.Content: This place is located perfectly for the Central Train Station and the centre of Town. From the outside it looks a bit worn and tired as does the main lobby and reception. The bar is pretty modern however as are the rooms. It is a bit of a maze getting to some rooms via 2 lifts and a footbridge and this is a pain when you need to run back to your room quickly. Service is average with some poor attitude by the concierge desk but don't let this put you off. Breakfast is average at best. This hotel is fine for 1-2 nights only , anything more than that and you may get tired of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LAINEYMAY
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of June. Very centrally located opposite the main entrance of the train station. Our room was a good size and very clean. Good sized bathroom with plenty of towels. Although situated in a busy area we were never disturbed by any noise. Reception staff all very friendly and concierge happy to help with any tourist information. Internet available free of charge in the lobby. There is a nice bar and restaurant but we ate and drank outside. Loads of bars and, restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. Would definately stay here if going to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “If you love trains and trams, this is the hotel for you!”
Reviews.Author: GordonChicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one block away from Amsterdam's Centraal Station. We stayed in room 511 which provided a wonderful view of the trains going in and out of the station along with the constant movement of trams. The windows however are well insulated so should you tire of the noise, shutting the window will provide peace and quiet. Notwthstanding the multitiudes on the sidewalk, the environment within the hotel is very quiet, peaceful, and dignified. Our room was quite spacious with two chairs and a writing desk. A buffet breakfast including hot and cold offerings is included in their rates. Two computers near the front desk are provided for guest use free of charge with printing privileges for those of us who do not bring our laptops. There is a restaurant which provides excellent dinners; just remember to allow two full hours to enjoy it, as is apparently the style in Europe. Overall our experience here was excellent and I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great staff . great location....allready miss you.”
Reviews.Author: LRONEN
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 days. what can I say' Every thing was great. the hotel is nice , clean , very good location' clean' rooms are comfortable and nice and quite big (we stayed at the urban wing) staff so nice and helpfull , Tim ,Chadid , Igor, Daniel and there were 3 more, I forgot their names ..sorry ..but you were so nice all of you are great' , also the girls from reception. thanks so much , my son enjoyed the stay at your hotel so much...would love to come back, recommend this hotel to anyone !

Reviews.Title: “Treated very badly , bullied & robbed by security after they woke us at 2am”
Reviews.Author: Arsenal2223
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times with my wife and never normally had any troubles . I stayed there for two nights earlier this week with a disabled friend we booked to stat two nights on the first night at roughly 2am we we're awoken by loud banging on the door which was obviously a shock . I shouted who is that I was told it was security and to open door which I did ( even though at this time of night I could have been answering to anyone robbers even ) they accused us of smoking of which we weren't I don't even smoke in my own home . I said no , he said they could smell smoke in corridor but we were not only occupied room on corridor . I agreed to let them in to basically search room they did & admitted finding no evidence if smoking but still they insisted well black mailed me into going straight downstairs with them to pay a 300 euro fine or I was told I would have to check out immediately ( as I said it was 2am and I had disabled friend with me ) so I felt I had no choice but to do this . When we checked out my bill said 300 Euro guest services not fine ( good job I have understanding trusting wife ) I spoke to person I charge who suggested I speak to manager . I have rang main office customer service number in Ireland today and was promised someone from hotel management would call me back surprise surprise no phone call !!!! Tried to get manager email but I'm unable to get this .... Basically I feel robbed & disgusted and fear what would have happened if it was two women in room or elderley couple or someone with no money !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Staff excellent”
Reviews.Author: SAM112
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary. The hospitality from the staff was exceptional and the meal that the chef Kelly cooked for us was superb. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, clean spacious rooms and right in the heart of Dam Square, within easy walking to any of the main tourist attractions. Thanks to all at the hotel for making our trip so special especially to Kelly, Nic and Jennifer, we had a fab time and really enjoyed our 40th anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Showing its age”
Reviews.Author: Papoofnik
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is both a plus and minus. Being across from Centraal Station makes it easy to get to around and its close to all of central Amsterdam by foot. Negative, and I presume room location dependent, you deal with Amsterdam traffic noise and the subway construction, especially the piledrivers. Much is outside of the hotel control, but still a consideration for some travelers. I chose the hotel and paid a hefty premium, 200 euro for the night, because I was getting into Schiphol very late, wanted a place close to the city to enjoy Amsterdam the following day before heading back to Schiphol that day. I had booked a single room, and am attempting to ascertain whether the booking agent has a very low priority with the hotel, but the room I was initially given was, by their management's own admission, one of the worst in the hotel. I cannot be certain if the front desk would have acquiesced to my complaint, but a hotel manager heard my anger as I was walking to the front desk. He immediately upgraded my room to an executive room without question. Consequently, I am most grateful that the type of complaint I had was expeditiously and very professionally dealt with by the management. As a consequence, the service given me was excellent at that point, and the issues I have are to a large extent outside their control. While not trying to be ungrateful, the room was a bit tired. I do not know if this was a renovated room, but certainly the furnishings were not. You know the mattress is old when you feel the springs poking out from the mattress under your feet.. Like much of Amsterdam, the prices are out of line for what you get - I have yet to find one that is value for money. This hotel certainly in my opinion is not. While the public areas are grandiose and certainly 4 star, they would need to make me feel more comfortable at a more attractive price to make a repeat visit for a longer stay. If i would do it again, for a quick in-out, I would stay at a Schiphol airport hotel, a much cheaper option..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but don't trust the maid service”
Reviews.Author: rkdgsd
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in April, 2010. Loved our stay there. Wonderful hotel with great location and breakfast buffet. But, one of the maids stole a brand new bottle of glucosamine(~$25). We spent few days in amsterdam before heading to india and the glucosaine was for my dad. Didn't realize until we got to india.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to celebrate a 40th Birthday”
Reviews.Author: LeaHB333
Reviews.Content: This place is in the heart of the city. Right next to the red light district, central station west and some really cool shopping. The Victoria is an old building, but fairly new renovations make is modern and comfy. I really loved having the balcony, so you could really feel the pulse of the city. The room service was good, the maid service was good and the hotel staff very friendly and courteous. I would recommend getting the upgraded Executive Room. The extra space makes a big difference. I would stay at this hotel again for sure if I was looking to party. I might try to find something a little quieter, if I was with a family or small childeren.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel in OK location”
Reviews.Author: LBOskiBear
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here last week on my first trip to Amsterdam. Room was large but felt a bit dated - I don't think I had one of the recently remodeled rooms. Bathroom was a bit tired. Had a room on the first floor facing the Centraal Station - very convenient but a bit noisy - although that's not the hotel's fault. If the price is right, I think this is a great location - I didn't check out any of the property's amenities so I can't comment on that. Breakfast buffet was good - but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: pfisher9316
Reviews.Content: Currently staying at this property, concierge very nice and personable, I chose this property over another one because it had a healthclub. I was very disappointed to find out there is 14.50E charge per person, per day. This fact should be disclosed on their website. Rooms are very stark and modern. Breakfast is expensive too 23E. Next time I will pick another hotel in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Small room, good breakfast and great location”
Reviews.Author: Machinehead28
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights from 6/6 untill 8/6. The room was one of the smallest room that I was stayed ever in my life in hotels, the bathroom was nice, but not 'wow'. The reception staff were very nice, breakfast was good for the area, but not so exeptional. One dissapointment - the fitness room cost money for the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, well positioned”
Reviews.Author: Mike1811027
Reviews.Content: Situated just accross the road from the Train Station this hotel was really handy to tours, transport and shoping. Friendly staff and a good atmosphere. The room was large, well appointed and comfortable. Good food, restaurants and bar.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: JoanneBrussels
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located opposite Central Station and within walking distance of touristy things to see. Professional, but disinterested staff. Nice room with comfortable bed and good bathroom. Tea/coffee maker in room. A problem with our bill was quickly solved. We went out for breakfast, since we found the breakfast buffet overpriced at 23â‚¬. There are lots of places in the area where you can eat at a more reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Far too expensive”
Reviews.Author: TravelTulip2
Reviews.Content: Great location and nice facade, the rooms are small and far less impresive. The rates are over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, beautiful urban room!”
Reviews.Author: Mrdorrestein101
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Park Plaza Victoria Amsterdam for the third time and it was great as allways! We stayed in a new renovated â€˜urbanâ€™ room. A modern and comfortable room and not to forget a quiet room! Great detail in the bathroom; heated mirror! Ideal when getting out of the shower and want to do your hear. A comfy bed, great view of the central station. Service was great, very friendly and helpfull. By the way, A swimmingpool in the hotel is awesome! Would definitly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it ! Best Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: keroppisonson
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Victoria Hotel in April, 2011. I can't stop telling my friends how good this hotel was. The location of the hotel is just next to Centraal Station which brings you from airport, and to different part of the nearby europe countries. We paid extra for the breakfast which we found it so worth the money! It includes everything you can think of, from smoked salmon, hot breakfast, to fresh fruits, pancakes etc. It also includes juices, espresso, latte etc. All staff got great smiles and offered help when needed. We also booked trips through the counter staff at the lobby, which gave us some discounts as well. Another GREAT feature is the free WIFI (hotel also has two lap top on the ground floor for customer use). We love this hotel and we love Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: ellijayjeff
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Park Plaza 3 times and wouldnt stay any where else in Amsterdam the location is the best and the sevice is fantastic. The hotel manager has always remembered me by name I have no idea how and why but find that to be bery impressive. Like I said no other Hotel in Amsterdam would even compare. Many thanks to Park Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended, good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MatildaExeter_Uk
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location immediately opposite the main station (buses, trams, boats and bikes too). Busy, but this is part of its charm. Restaurant is good. Staff were very friendly and helpful. I was checked into a room on the first floor and I asked to be moved up because of the street noise. This was absolutely no trouble and I was offered a choice of two on the 5th floor. I took the one at the front overlooking the station. Breakfast was included and it was a good buffet choice. It was very convenient for all the major sights and, of course, the transport links were just outside. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Competent, centrally located and excellent service - but...”
Reviews.Author: newmikey
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located directly opposite Amsterdam's Central railwaystation and should be a doddle to find coming from Schiphol airport or anywhere else. The service is friendly and with a smile (which is much appreciated - the smile is a cheap but very appreciated way to face a customer!). Although the place does seem like a maze, with its many passageways and interconnected buildings, it actually is quite well furnished. The coffee in the meeting rooms is of the one-shot, brew your own expresso kind: top marks for that! The coffee in the room is the old-fashioned instant sachets - come on, a 4-star can do better! The meeting rooms and all of the lower-level hallways and corridors have a nasty smell, almost sewage-like and I did think I caught a whiff of that upstairs as well - not in the rooms though. The rooms themselves are adequately furnished and although WIFI is advertised as free, it is actually NOT! What you get is a bare-bottom, excruciatingly slow connection that will barely support bringing up one webpage, let alone trying to connect into a VPN for work. To do that, one has to go back to paying for the connection. So, although the highspeed connectivity is there, it is purposely crippled unless you pay. This is TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE in 2011 in a hotel that advertises itself as 4 stars and causes it to get bumped off the bottom of my list. If you are sightseeing or vacationing in Amsterdam: this is as good as it gets. If you are here for business: there are literally tons of hotels around offering better facilities at an equal or better price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: jjmod
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Victoria Park Plaza for one night and really enjoyed the hotel! Location cannot be better and service was great! Made use of room service (there was no menu in room) but when I called to get a menu it got delivered in record time! Also when placing my order the lady was so friendly and efficient. Basic free internet works well but would like to have a faster connection in such a awesome hotel! Check in and out could go a bit faster but as leisure guest we had all the time in the world. Would definitely make use of the hotel again when sleeping over in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel in heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: DPatel20
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was perfect as hotel in the heart of city, 2 mins walk from Centraal stations. It was ideal for us as we used to walk around, then take break at the hotel and then start again. Our room had a modern look and had amazing views of the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty”
Reviews.Author: NEILPATEL1978
