Reviews.Content: this hotel was right in the heart of the city center, bang opp to Centraal station. Very nice and helpful people. During the summer time, the price was too high, but still we liked it. The bar was very beautiful, must have a drink kind.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Cat365
Reviews.Content: The staff is super friendly and helpful. The make our trip very terrific. Location is awesome, close to everything. Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff and history in the walls”
Reviews.Author: cbpils
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent last weekend in Amsterdam. Some friends had recommanded Victoria hotel so we took a shot. We came late in the eveneing and the first thing we saw when we came out of the Centrall Station was Victoria hotel, perfect. The check in took a few more minutes than it's supposed to do, I think the girl was new. We got a room in the urban wing wich was recently renovated. The room was small but the bed was big (wich was good since we spent a LOT of time in it) and it had a flat screen tv. The bathroom was clean and nice. One aber with the room; the maids didn't seem to be so musch into vacuuming! On the first day I spilled some mineralpowder on the carpet and that was still there on the day we left! Also they didn't remove empty bottles, no sorts of dusting and I think they didn't do much else with the bathroom than replace towels. In the closet I found some personalstuff left by the previous guest (including abottle of lube, gross).- So MINUS for the cleaning. The staff on this hotell is excellent! Everey night we had drinks in the hotel bar and the barkeeper was VERY friendly and treated us like kings! The concierges was really friendly and helpfull too! They greated us every day and asked us if every thing was okay. We really felt like we were in good hands and felt athome in Victoria hotel. We only tried the Brasserie once, the staff was (as in the rest of the hotell) very nice and helpful. My husband ordered fish and was very satisfied. Whereas I ordered a pasta dish that didn't taste that great. It was not good at all I.M.O. Not too pricy and the food came quickly. The location on this hotell is Alfa Omega and it has a super staff (minus some of the maids). I can not say too many times how pleased I am with the service and if ever in Amsterdam again I will definetly stay at Park Plaza Victoria and cross my fingers that they have employed cleaning staff who acctually DOES their JOB!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great vacation at the Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: bigsky7
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 days at the Park Plaza and we had a fabulous time. If it is your first time in Amsterdam, this is the place to stay. The location is perfect. Everything is within walking distance or a short tram ride. The concierge was very helpful giving us tips and directions on our daily excursions. Everyone on the hotel staff was polite and friendly and we did not have any negative experiences. We only ate at the b-fast buffet each morning, but the food was fresh and delicious. This hotel is one block from central station and it is very convenient to catch a train from the airport (7 euro). A big thank you to the Park Plaza for making our vacation a success. Will def stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel - Reasonable Location”
Reviews.Author: texanscot99
Reviews.Content: I stayed the weekend here prior to business meetings in Antwerp. The hotel is well situated just across the road from the train station and from where most of the canal boats leave. Rooms in the hotel are small (at least mine was) and some of them (126, 127) have no view at all other than the roof of the lower floor. Enough space for 1 person however I can imagine that two people may find the space a little cramped. Breakfast was very busy - I arrived at 9:30 am on Sat morning to find the dining room packed with people. Staff were doing their best to keep the buffet full but were clearly overwhelmed. I asked for two fried eggs only to be shouted at by the waitress that the kitchen was very busy and that they would take 20 mins. She did come over 5 mins later to apologise and ask if I would still like the eggs however the damage had been done. Given that breakfast is expensive (23 euro's) I expect better service and an experience that is less like eating in a college cafeteria. There are plenty of small restaurants nearby that serve food just as good for half the price and I would advise others to try this option. I paid $250 a night through priceline - standard rate was around $350 a night. The hotel is just about alright at $250 however I would suggest that it is at the lower end of the price to value spectrum. At $350 a night I would say that you are most definitely going to be disappointed by what you receive for your custom and hard earned money.

Reviews.Title: “Just excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: PerditaFall
Reviews.Content: I wandered in a harassed and exhausted traveller after being stranded for a night in Amsterdam with no help offered by my airline. The moment I walked in I felt completely cared for. I wanted to be careful with this unexpected cost to my trip, and despite the front desk being obviously busy the man there was happy to show me a room before I committed and was also fine for me to take a bit of time to think about it. He was friendly, efficient and recognised I'd had a hard day; and without me asking, very generously gave me a room above my price range (I know this because the room I ended up in was much nicer than the one I was first shown). I wouldn't expect this every time and me arriving very late probably made it possible, but still, not everybody would do this. So in operational style and service this is an an old-fashioned hotel, which has taken the trouble to upgrade its offering and decor according to contemporary expectations. The room was plush and comfortable in a classic way, and very well-appointed. I appreciated extremely the free internet which most hotels use as an opportunity to make a fast buck - it was fast enough for basic things. Another very nice touch was the provision of four different types of plug socket above the desk, for international travellers. As I've lived in Amsterdam before, being so close to the not particularly charming Centraal and the Damrak doesn't really appeal to me, with their hordes of stag nights, and may not appeal to those who want to wake up somewhere and feel like a real Amsterdammer on a quaint canal etc. But for anyone on a first-time holiday, the location couldn't be better, and it's literally only a couple of streets to get out of 'tourist' Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, great value”
Reviews.Author: CamLovesSun
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 days and would definitely stay again. The location is perfect, opposite the station, 5mins walk to Dam square and minutes away from bars, coffee shops and restaurants. The beds were comfortable and the room and bathroom were clean and modern. The breakfast buffet was also nice with a selection of continental dishes. By no means an american buffet but it did the job. The only complaint I would have is there was not an iron or iron board in the room. I would expect all 4 star and even 3 star hotels to have this as it seems pretty basic to me.

Reviews.Title: “a terrific job”
Reviews.Author: the_dutch_hans
Reviews.Content: we just stayed at our favorite hotel in Amsterdam and they booken us in a brand new room, the designer did a great job, staff as always very friendly and now in combination of renovated rooms!! we can't wait to come back

HotelInfo.Name: Park Plaza Victoria Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Damrak 1 - 5, Amsterdam 1012 LG, The Netherlands
